loans.name: Matlyuba

texts.ru: Матлюба жительница города Исфара. Она замужем. Ей 50 лет. У нее четверо детей. Она занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном Матлюба занимается торговлей женских и мужских носков оптом. В этой области он 28 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента своего товара.
texts.en: Matlyuba is a resident of Isfara. She is 50 years old, married and has four children. Matlyuba sells socks for men and women at the local market. She has been working in retail for the last 28 years. She is taking out this loan to expand her inventory.

loans.use: to expand inventory

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Linda sells canned goods, snacks & beverages in her shop. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Linda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Linda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Filister

texts.en:
Filister is 51 years old, a modest lady married to Charles, a retired doctor. They live in the Mugen area of Vihiga County, Western Kenya, and they have five children.

Filister operates a chemist shop in Mugen and has been in this trade for the last ten years. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stocks of drugs to sell in her shop. 

She will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family’s basic needs. Her hope is to expand her business through KADET funding.

loans.use: to buy drugs for her chemist shop

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en:
Gregory is a 42-year-old man from the Kapkures area in Vihiga, a town situated in Western Kenya. He is married to Rael, and they have four children.

Gregory is a livestock trader in Vihiga, selling mainly cattle due to its high demand in the area, and he has done this business for the last 16 years. He is taking out his eighth loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy livestock for sale. 

He will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family’s basic needs, like food, clothing, and shelter. He hopes to continue accessing loans from KADET so as to expand his livestock business.

loans.use: to buy cattle for sale

loans.name: Jorenda

texts.en:
Jorenda is a married woman, having four children. Jorenda is 41 years old, residing at Ozamis, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Jorenda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as soaps, snack foods and etc. to earn a living and she's been 11 years in this business. Each month, she earns 10,000.00 doing this type of business. 

Jorenda has requested a loan of 25,000.00 to purchase additional product to sell. Jorenda has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Jorenda wants to build her own house and to pay for the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional product to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
Nagina is an animal seller. She has some goats and sheep, which she sells by growing them up to butcher. She is also a very skillful seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients on order. She is very passionate about her sewing business and works very hard to satisfy her clients.
Her husband operates a motorbike spare parts selling business. He offers different brands and types of spare parts, which helps him in capturing a good number of clients every month.

Nagina is the mother of 4 sons, all of them are masons, by profession. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further improvement of her husband’s spare parts selling business. With the loan investment, he will buy different types of motorcycle spare parts to attract more clients to his shop and to increase his income. He has been operating his business for many years and Nagina is very much hopeful about his business success after the loan investment.

Note: "In the photo, the lady holding the passbook (called Asasah Passbook) is Nagina."

loans.use: to buy mortorcycle spare parts for her spare parts selling business.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a married woman with three children. Jacinta is 51 years old and resides at Clarin, Misamis Occidental, The Philippines. 

Jacinta owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she has been nine years in this business. Each month she earns PHP 3,660 doing this type of business. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase products to sell.  Jacinta has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Jacinta wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nozimjon

texts.ru: Нозимчон сорокасемилетний женатый мужчина. Он проживает в городе Исфара. У него четверо детей. Нозимчон предоставляет услугу на своем грузовом автомобиле. Он берет кредит для ремонта автомобиля.
texts.en: Nozimjon is a forty year old married man. he lives in the city of Isfara and has four children. Nozimjon uses his truck in his transportation business and needs this loan to repair the vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 36 years old and married to Aggrey. They have been blessed with three children: 14, 11, and 6 years old. She has run a chemist outlet for the last nine years. 

Her monthly income is 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), and she is servicing a first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD. She intends to acquire more drugs for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to improve and expand the business

loans.name: Lionedo

texts.en:
Lionedo is 50 years old and married.  He devotes himself full-time to taking care of his rice farming business. When the harvest comes, his hard work means that he can sell good quality products to increase his net profits. His income is about PHP 29,000 every season (every five months). He has fifteen years of experience in this field.  His wife manages their hog-raising business and earns additional income to help meet their daily needs. 

Lionedo is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for his farm business.  He believes that this loan will help him to make improvements to his business.  He is hoping that he will have a plentiful harvest to support the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for his farm business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali lives in Changamwe, Kenya. He is single. There is a large population in the area, mainly Mombasa port workers. It is in this background that he began the fast-moving consumer goods shop, which he has operated for twenty years. He was introduced to Milango by a friend. Ali is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase more retail stock, e.g., sugar, flour, rice, and sodas. Ali would like to convert his own house into rental units by making modifications. He will use the extra income from the business to support his extended family’s education needs.

loans.use: To purchase more retail stock, e.g., sugar, flour, rice, and sodas

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tumaini Group in Western Kenya! Dina is the facilitator of the Tumaini group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Dina takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Dina had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Dina was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dina and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Dina will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tumaini group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Dina with her group members and the field officer on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Upendo Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Upendo SHG Group in Western Kenya! Irene is the facilitator of the Upendo SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Irene is a mother of four children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Irene and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Irene will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Upendo SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. Irene is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 29 years old, married to Robinson, and blessed with one 7-year-old child. She has run a chemist/pharmacy shop for the past six years. Her monthly income is 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), and she is servicing a first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD. 

She intends to acquire additional stocks of drugs for her shop. She plans to use the additional profits to improve her family’s living standard and expand her business. Her future hope is to explore business opportunities enabled by KADET to meet her goals.

loans.use: to add to her stock of drugs for sale

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 20 лет. Она не замужем. Имеет среднее образование. Живет вместе с родителями. Ее отец строитель, а мать занимается шитьем. Сама она уже восемь лет занимается шитьем мешков. Она берет кредит для покупки необходимых тканей.
texts.en: Zulaykho lives in Isfara. She is 20 years old, single and has a high school degree. Zulaykho lives with her parents. Her father is a construction worker and her mother is a seamstress. Zulaykho herself has been sewing sacks for the last eight years. She needs this loan to buy fabric to sew more sacks for sale.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 27 years old and a single man. He has been selling clothes and assorted items for the last year. His monthly income is about KES 14,000, and with a first loan of KES 30,000, he intends to purchase an additional stock of clothes for resale. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits by opening another business channel. His future hopes and dreams are to create employment to others.

loans.use: To expand the business by purchasing more stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maynard

texts.en:
Maynard is 21 years old, married and has one child.  At his age, he is very young to have his own family. But because of the situation, he needs to make a sacrifice and surrender his freedom for the sake of his family. His young age doesn’t stop him engaging in the farming business. As he has always said “if others can do, I can do it too”, so he patiently works hard at his farming business.

To produce greater profits, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy pesticides, fertilizers and pay for labour costs.  With his little experience in farming, he knows that he cannot do it alone especially when he feels financial constraints.  Hopefully, through this financial assistance and his endurance, he will yield better crops in the harvesting season.

By then, he will be able to provide for the needs of his family as well as save for their future.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers and to pay for labour costs

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sorn is 30 years old and a humble villager from Kompong Speu province. He has a common law relationship with his wife, and they don't have any children. Mr. Sorn works as a driver for a rich family and gets a monthly salary. To help him make money, his wife works in a sewing business in Phnom Penh.  Mr. Sorn is a responsible and helpful man. 

Mr. Sorn will use the $900 loan to open a hairdressing salon for his sister. She has just finished learning how to be a hairdresser. He appreciates the support and hopes that lenders will not reject his loan request.

loans.use: to open a hairdressing salon for his sister.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a 37-year-old mother of four children. She is a secondhand clothes dealer in Bamburi, Mombasa, and her business has been in operation for the last four years. The business is doing well.

This marks Tabitha’s second borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business, and with the money she plans to purchase more stock of secondhand clothes and clothing materials and to expand her shop. 

With the anticipated profit she hopes to educate her children and also pay back the KADET loan. In future, Tabitha hopes to expand her business and to become a wholesaler for secondhand clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of secondhand clothes and lessos (traditional screen printed cloth).

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Janerose is the facilitator of the Umoja group. Janerose and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Janerose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Janerose takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. With income from maize sales, Janerose will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Umoja group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Janerose with her group members and the person on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Simana Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Simana SHG Group in Western Kenya! Jackline is the facilitator of the Simana SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Jackline takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed her family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure good farm yield. In the recent 2011 season, she had a good maize yield harvesting 6 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jackline was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jackline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

 With income from maize sales, Jackline will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Simana SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maqsood Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Maqsood Bibi is a 55-year-old woman. She is married and lives with her family, a husband and three children who are 22, 21, and 19 years old. Her elder son is an expert at making embroidered dresses while her younger son works for a private company. Her daughter is a nurse and works in a clinic.  Maqsood and her husband are very hard-working by nature. They both work in order to help each other financially.

Maqsood owns and operates a sewing business from her home. She takes orders from her community clients and bases her fees on the work she is asked to do.  Her clients are satisfied with her and don’t argue about her rates.

Her husband is a scrap dealer who sells scrap to factories and other scrap dealers at a profit.  Maqsood is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He intends to use the loan to purchase scrap in bulk, which he will sell in order to generate more revenue. Maqsood is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to his business and her family’s standard of living will be improved further. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Maqsood Bibi.

loans.use: to buy scrap to sell.

loans.name: Ambana W Group

texts.en:
Agnes is the facilitator of the Ambana W group. Agnes and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Agnes and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Agnes takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for his family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Agnes had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Agnes was only able to harvest 14 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Agnes will invest in livestock rearing and buy more land for future use with her savings.

In 2012, the members of Ambana W group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Agnes is pictured with her group members and the field officer is on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Imani Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Imani Group in Western Kenya! Jeridah is the facilitator of the group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Jeridah takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jeridah had a good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jeridah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Jeridah will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in business. In 2012, the members of Imani group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to his stock of fruits, like bananas, mangoes and pineapples.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Mrs. Yen is a 48-year-old married woman who lives in Baray district, Cambodia. To earn a living, Yen sells fresh fish in a local market. She also raises piglets in her backyard - both for slaughter and for offerings. She has four children who are all single and live with her in her thatched house.  

Mrs. Yen is requesting a loan from HKL and Kiva to supplement her capital so she can tile the roof of her house and expand it. The loan will provide her family with a more comfortable standard of living. In the future, she plans to improve her pig-fattening business.

loans.use: to tile the roof of her house and expand it.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 25 years old and single. He runs a cyber café business in Mikindani, Mombasa, and the business has been in operation for two years. The business is doing well and he has been able to serve many people. He also runs an M-pesa money transfer business in Mikindani.

This marks Solomon’s first borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business, and with the money he plans to purchase more float for his M-pesa. With the anticipated profits he hopes to be able to repay his KADET loan and to expand his businesses even further.

In future Solomon hopes to open up a new cyber café in a different location in Mombasa.

loans.use: to purchase more float for his M-pesa

loans.name: Faustine

texts.en:
Faustine is 36 years old and married to Haron, a businessman who brings some additional income to the family. They have been blessed with four children of the following ages: 14,10, 8, and 6.

She runs a carpentry business and right now her monthly income from the business is about KES 10,000. She is borrowing a loan of KES 30,000, with which she intends to boost her business by adding more stock.

This is her second loan, and she successfully paid her previous loan. Her hopes and dreams are to expand the business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To add more stock to her business.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a married man of thirty-one years. He has three children, and they live in Ruaka in Kiambu. He operates a video show business in Kiambu and has been in this business for eight years now. Walter gets a monthly income of about fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Walter's first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to buy more dvds for his video show, and will use part of the money to renovate the video showroom. In future he wants to own two other showrooms in different centers in Kiambu.

loans.use: To renovate his video showroom and buy more dvds.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is 57 years old, married and thankful because he has been blessed with two children.  He has been a farmer for almost twenty years. He usually plants rice and raises hogs to sell.  His ambition in life is to improve the quality of living for his family.  Sometimes there are problems in his family, but through their strong determination, they survive.

Rodolfo wants to cultivate two hectares of farm land to plant more rice. But he lacks the necessary capital, thus he wants to borrow PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and corn seeds and to pay for the labour costs required to plant rice.  He believes that this loan will help him to make a growth in his business.  He is hoping that he will have a plenteous harvest to support his family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and corn seeds and to pay for the labour costs required to plant rice.

loans.name: Amani Group

texts.en:
Irene is the facilitator of the Amani group. Irene and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Irene and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Irene takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send her children to school and secure enough food for her children. In the recent 2011 season, Irene had a very good maize yield harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Irene was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Irene will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Amani group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Irene is pictured with her group members and the field officer standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 44 years old man, he is married with three sons and two daughters.  He works in agriculture, which is the only source of income to the family. 

Ahmad wants to pay the university fees of his three sons who are studying Law, English language and Economics but he does not have enough money to pay for this.  So he needs to take a loan from FATEN.  When Ahmad gets the loan, he will be able to pay his sons' university fees so they will be able to continue their studies and develop to themselves in work and life.  Ahmad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for three of his sons.

loans.name: Crizalde

texts.en:
Crizalde is 32 years of age. He is married to Juanita and blessed with two children. He decided to get involved in farming in order to improve their standards of living. He works hard to give his children a good quality of life and lift them out of poverty.

He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase corn seed, fetilizer and pesticides for his corn farm. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his profits.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, fertilizer and pesticides for his corn farm.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is from the village of Gomi in West Georgia. He is 31 years old, married, and lives with his family: his wife, Lorita, his two-year-old daughter and his mother who is retired. 

The family's main source of income is agriculture. They have three milk cows and make cheese, which is sold on the local market to local dairy products retailers. The family also owns two hectares of land where they grow maize, nuts and vines. Teimuraz sells the products he harvests on the local market. In addition, Teimuraz owns a tractor. Local farmers hire him to till their land which provides him with additional income. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris. 

Teimuraz has requested a loan to renovate the family home. It is old and in bad condition. After the renovation, the family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Manuk

texts.en:
Manuk is 22 years old. He lives in Tsovagyugh village in the Sevan area with his parents and his brother. Manuk is studying by correspondence at Yerevan State Economic University, and at the same time Manuk and his family members are engaged in animal breeding. They have a plot of land where they raise cows, pigs and chickens. The main line of their business is cattle breeding, so they produce a large amount of milk, which they sell to a procurement agency, and meat that they sell to butcher shops. 

Thanks to farming, Manuk and his family provide for themselves and pay for Manuk’s education. To increase the family’s income Manuk intends to develop his farm, and so he is seeking a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy 3 more cows.

loans.use: To buy 3 more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 53 years old, married, and the father of one child. He operates an agrovet business (providing farm and animal products) and has been in it for the last three years with a monthly profit of approximately KES 20,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his second loan of KES 60,000 from the company, which he plans to use to purchase a scale, fertilizers and other farm supplies. 

The client will save the anticipated profit and continue taking care of his family. In future, Paul hopes to grow his business and be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: To buy a scale, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Twigwaneko Group

texts.fr:
Hassan est un commerçant âgé de 48 ans qui habite  dans le quartier Nyamugarie de la commune  urbaine de  Gitega de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Il a un restaurant comme business depuis 10 ans, un métier qu’il a commencé alors qu’il était chauffeur. Il a fait ses études jusqu’en 7 è année secondaire. Il est marié à Anne Marie, une enseignante et ont ensemble 3 enfants  dont 1 étudie à l’école secondaire et les 2 autres sont au primaire.
Son  crédit Kiva qu’il obtient va lui permettre d’augmenter son capital pour augmenter la  quantité de  nourriture au restaurant afin de servir un grand nombre de personnes afin de  réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies 
Il est membre du groupe communautaire TWIGWANEKO
texts.en: Hassan is a 48-year-old entrepreneur who lives in the Nyamugarie neighborhood of the town of Gitega, in Gitega province, central Burundi.  He has been owning a restaurant for 10 years.  He started in the restaurant business while he was working as a driver.  He is educated through 7th grade.  He is married to a teacher, Anne Marie, and together they have 3 children, of whom one is in middle school and the other 2 attend elementary school.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 170,000 Burundian Francs, which will allow him to increase his capital in order to serve more food to more people, and therefore to generate bigger profits and increase his savings.  Hassan is a member of the TWIGWANEKO community group.

loans.use: To increase his capital in order to serve more food to more people and therefore to generate bigger profits and increase his savings.

loans.name: Dutsimbatare Group

texts.fr:
Rémegia est une commerçante âgée de 50 ans qui habite la localité de Kibimba  à 21km de la ville de Gitega  en Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle est vendeuse  de tomates depuis 15ans. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6 è année primaire. Elle est veuve et c’est bien son mari qui l’a appris ce métier de vendre les tomates avant de mourir. Elle a 6 enfants  qui sont tous   mariés.
Son crédit Kiva de 140,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient va lui permettre d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup de paniers de tomates à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire DUTSIMBATARE
texts.en:
Rémegia is a 50-year-old retail merchant who lives in the village of Kibimba, 21 km from the city of Gitega, part of Gitega Province in the central part of the country.

She has been selling tomatoes for 15 years. She attended school until 6th grade. She is a widow and her husband taught her how to trade tomatoes before he died. She has six children, all married.

Kiva's credit loan of 140,000 Burundian francs will allow her to increase her working capital so she can buy many baskets of tomatoes for retail sales, make large profits and increase her savings. She is a member of the Dutsimbatare community group.

loans.use: increase her working capital to buy many baskets of tomatoes for retail sales, to make large profits and increase her savings

loans.name: Namukenge Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Namukenge Group in Western Kenya! It is headed by Roselyne as its facilitator. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Roselyne takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had a good maize yield harvesting 16 1/2 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Roselyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

 With income from maize sales, Roselyne will educate her children and invest in business. 

In 2012, the members of Namukenge group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gumyumutima Group

texts.fr:
Espérance est une commerçante âgée de 32 ans qui habite la localité de Mutobo en Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle est vendeuse  de bananes depuis 8ans, un métier qu’elle a commencé alors qu’elle était cultivatrice. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6 è année  primaire. Elle est mariée à Prosper et ont ensemble 3 enfants qui n’ont encore atteint l’âge de scolarité.
Son crédit Kiva de 120,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient va  lui permettre d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantité de bananes à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire GUMYUMUTIMA
texts.en:
Hope is a 32-year-old retail merchant who lives in the town of Gitega, part of the Province of Mutobo in the center of the country.

She has been retailing bananas for the past eight years, a trade she started when she was crop farming. She attended school up to the 6th grade. She is married to Prosper with whom she had three children, all under school age.

Kiva's credit loan of 120,000 Burundian francs will enable her to increase her capital and buy large quantities of bananas for retail sales, in order to realize large profits and increase her savings. She is a member of the Gumyumutima community group.

loans.use: increase her working capital to buy large quantities of bananas for retail sales in order to realize large profits and increase her savings

loans.name: Twitezimbere Group

texts.fr:
Consolate est une commerçante âgée de 43 ans qui habite la localité de Songa de  la Commune et Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle  vend  de la bière en détaillant depuis 11 ans, un métier qu’elle a commencé alors qu’elle était  une travailleuse à la  banque (Meridian Bank). Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 9è année secondaire. Elle est mariée à Dieudonné qui est un travailleur à la PAM, et ont ensemble 3 enfants dont 2 sont à l’école secondaire et 1 autres  au primaire. Sa famille héberge 1 garçon qui a maintenant 25 ans de  la parenté proche.
Son crédit  Kiva de 250,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient va lui permettre  d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup de caisses de bière à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire TWITEZIMBERE
texts.en:
Consolate is a 43-year-old retail merchant who lives in the village of Songa, part of the Commune and Province of Gitega in the central region.

She has been retailing beer for the past 11 years, a job she started when she was an employee at the Meridian Bank. She studied up to the 9th grade.

She is married to Dieudonné who is a worker at the WFP (World Food Program), and with whom she has three children: two are in high school and one in primary. Her family also hosts a 25-year-old close relative.

Kiva's credit loan of 250,000 Burundian francs will bolster her working capital. This will enable her to buy many cases of beer for retail sales, in order to realize large profits and increase her savings.

She is a member of the Twitezimbere community group.

loans.use: increase her capital and buy many cases of beer for retail sales, in order to realize large profits and increase her savings

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
Naziran, who lives with her husband and daughter, focuses her days on taking care of her family and raising her daughter with great care. Her husband sells groceries, stocking his store with new products as often as possible. Located in an area with many other stores, he tries to compete through quality of service and meeting the needs of every customer.

Naziran is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband to purchase groceries in bulk to sell in his store. She hopes that her husband will further grow the business and improve the quality of services offered after the loan investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naziran.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her husband's grocery store business.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is 41 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She is in the transport business, and has been in it for the last three years with a monthly profit of about KES 9,000. 

She  was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of KES 21,000 from the company. She plans to use part of the loan to service her motorcycle, and part to open up a small cafe in Ganda in Malindi town. 

She will save the anticipated profit to help take care of her children. In future, Hidaya hopes to grow her businesses and be financially stable.

loans.use: To service her motorcycle and open up a small cafe.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 35-year-old married man living with his wife and six school-aged children. Due to technological innovations, he decided in 2009 to start his own business of installing and programming internet networks. He’s really satisfied with the results he has attained so far. 

Today he’s requesting to borrow $1,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand his business by enlarging his internet network in order to satisfy the demands of new customers, and therefore to increase his earnings. In the future, he plans to install a new internet network in another area.

loans.use: to expand his business by enlarging his internet network.

loans.name: Turwanyubukene Group

texts.fr:
Azina  est une commerçante âgée de 27 ans qui habite dans le quartier Nyamugari de la Commune urbaine de Gitega de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle vend des arachides depuis 11 ans, un métier qu’elle a commencé alors qu’elle était commerçante de farine de manioc. Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est mariée à Yusufu , lui aussi commerçant de pommes de terre et ont ensemble 5 enfants dont 2 sont à l’école primaire et 3 autres sont encore à la maison.Sa famille héberge 2 enfants de la parenté proche.
Son crédit  Kiva de 200,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient va lui permettre d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantité d’arachides à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire TURWANYUBUKENE
texts.en:
Azina is a trader who is 27 years old and lives in the Nyamugari district of the urban municipalitiy of Gitega, which lies in Gitega province in the centre of the country. She has been selling groundnuts for 11 years, a business she began when she was trading cassava flour. She did not attend school. She is married to Yusufu, who is also a trader selling potatoes; together they have five children, two of whom are at primary school and the other three still at home. Her family also has two children of close relatives living with them. 

The Kiva loan of 200,000 burundi francs which she is being granted will allow her to increase her capital in order to buy a large quantity of groundnuts for resale, so that she can make a large profit and increase her savings.

She is a member of the Turwanyubukene community group.

loans.use: to increase her capital in order to buy a large quantity of groundnuts for resale so that she can make a large profit and increase her savings

loans.name: Sameeh

texts.en: Sameeh is a 25-year-old man, he is married with three daughters.  He owns a grocery store, which is the only source of income to the family. Sameeh wants to purchase more groceries to better his collection of sale items including rice, sugar and soft drinks but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for this so he needs to borrow a loan of $1,000 from FATEN.  When Sameeh gets the loan, he will purchase more groceries and increase his selection.  This will increase his sales and so increase his income, which will allow his family to improve their living conditions.  Sameeh is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Latifaan's Group

texts.en:
Latifaan is a housewife and also a working lady. She supports her husband in his shoe making business. Shoe making is her family business and her husband and her five children all work collectively to afford their living expenses.

Her children are also continuing their education.  In the morning they go to a nearby school and only help their father in his business after returning from school.

Latifaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her family business.  With the loan investment he will buy leather and shoe laces for preparing a larger quantity of shoes that will help him fulfil his larger orders on time and increase his profits.

He has been operating his business for many years and Latifaan is very hopeful that an investment will be productive for him.

loans.use: to buy leather and shoe laces for her shoe making business.

loans.name: Malis

texts.en:
Malis (pictured with her loom) is 31 years old and her husband, Sao, is 39 years old.  They live in a village along the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons, two of which are in school, the other is still young. 

Malis is a weaver, while her husband is a construction worker.  In addition Malis and her husband also raise fish at home. She is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and also to buy fish to raise and fish feed.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and to buy fish to raise and fish feed.

loans.name: Mas

texts.en:
Mas is 43 and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She sells fish and her husband buys lotus leaves to sell. 

Mas is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more fish to sell. Her loan will enable her family to generate more income. In the future, Mas would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 30 years old and is married to Leah. For the past year, he has operated a computer and computer accessories business in Ndunyu Njeru town. Joseph was introduced to KADET by a credit officer and this will be his first loan.  

Joseph is requesting a loan to buy assorted computer accessories and stock up his business due to the ready market available in the region. In the future, he hopes to expand his business by importing computer accessories directly from abroad. He wants to become the best computer entrepreneur in the region to increase his income, thereby improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy (pictured here), age 25, is single, and lives with his mother in a village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophy is a rice farmer. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $700 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.name: Knkush

texts.en:
Knkush is from Ninotsminda, South Georgia. She is 37 years old, married and lives with her husband, two daughters (18 and 17 years old), a son (12 years old), and parents-in-law (retired).  Knkush’s children go to school. They receive monthly social assistance from the government, as they live in poverty.  Knkush leads the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of the income for them.  In particular, the family owns 2 milk cows. They sell milk locally.  Also, Knkush grows potatoes on a family-owned plot of land.  These are also sold locally. Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. 

Knkush requested credit for purchasing materials for changing the roof of the house. The old roof is in bad condition and can’t keep rain and snow out of the house. The family needs to change it in order to keep the house warm during winter months.

loans.use: to purchase materials for changing the roof of the house

loans.name: Mas

texts.en:
Mas is 45 and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband sell fish and firewood. 

Mas is requesting a 700 USD loan to purchase more firewood to sell. Her loan will enable her family to generate more income. In the future, Mas would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy Nyabusi is a 30-year-old mother of four children. For the past nine years, she has been a wholesale charcoal dealer in Magongo, Mombasa. The business is doing well and she now plans to diversify and open up a cinema entertainment place.


Dorothy is requesting a loan to purchase a television for her new business. This will be Dorothy’s fourth loan from KADET LTD. With the anticipated profit from her loan, she hopes to educate her children and to repay back her KADET loan. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and buy land.

loans.use: to purchase a television for her new business

loans.name: Yang

texts.en:
Yang (pictured here) and her husband, Ly, live in a suburb about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They have been married since 1994 and have one son and two daughters. One is a garment worker and the other two are in school.  

Yang is a garment worker, while her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to get to work because she commutes to work by taking a taxi often. Taking a taxi to work is expensive for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to get work.

loans.name: Imaly

texts.en:
Imaly is 51 and she resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband sell groceries. 

Imaly is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to purchase more groceries to stock the store. She will also buy a motorbike for the family to use. This will enable her family to generate more income and also decrease their public transportation expenses. In the future, Imaly would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell and a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 63-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife, five working children and two others who are still studying. He has been working in security in a local hotel since 2007. After finding it hard to cover his daughter’s heavy educational fees, he decided to borrow $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay her courses at the university. He believes in the importance of education and is ready to sacrifice as much as possible in order to see his child achieving higher educational levels. In the future, he plans to open his own security company and hire people to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to pay his child’s university fees.

loans.name: Ravshanjon

texts.ru: Равшанчон житель города Исфара. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена занимается шитьем национальной верхней мужской одежды (джома). Дети учатся в средней школе. Сам он занимается торговлей сухофруктов. Кроме того он подрабатывает строительными работами по найму. Кредит берет для закупа сухофруктов.
texts.en: Ravshanjon lives in Isfara. He is 36 years old, married and has three children. His children are still attending school. Ravshanjon's wife is a seamstress and makes traditional Tajik men overcoats (djoma) for sale. He himself sells dried fruit at the local market as well as works as a construction worker on the side. Ravshanjon needs this loan to purchase dried fruits wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruit

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Mrs. Seang is 40 years old and a mother of 3 school-aged children. She has been operating a fish selling business in a local market of Baray district, and she typically earns around $2.00 per day. She also takes some time to look after her piglets at home. Last month there was a small flood in her commune and there are many difficulties for people there. But now everything seems to be going well, so Mrs. Seang wants to take this opportunity to begin another business for more income. She will sell sugar cane juice for students in front of a local school from her motorcycle (this motorcycle is connected with a trailer at the side and has a machine for squeezing sugar cane as well).  However, Mrs. Seang has inadequate capital to buy this kind of motor vehicle to start up this new business.  She is turning to Kiva’s funders for support. She is very happy and thankful to all lenders.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle (this motorcycle is connected with a trailer at the side, has a machine for squeezing sugar cane as well).

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years old, married to Emmanuel, and she supports a family of four members. They have been blessed with one child who is three years old. 

She has been running a stationery shop and cyber cafe for the last five years. Her monthly income from the business is about KES 30,000. She is requesting her first loan of KES 10,000, with which she intends to purchase additional stationery. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to expand her business and uplift her living standards. Her hope and dream is that KADET will help her achieve her lifetime expectations.

loans.use: To purchase additional stationery.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti is a 57-year-old lady who is married to Mulyono, 57 years old. They are blessed with three children namely: Rony, 31; Arif, 29, both married; and Surya, 27.

Siti has been running a kiosk for six years using her own capital. She sells daily necessities such as detergent, bath soap, brooms, wheat flour, cigarettes, candies, etc. In addition to running a kiosk, Siti and Mulyono also have a rented room business that enables her to generate more income for her family’s living. 

Siti is planning to improve her kiosk by adding more stock needed. She is requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She would like to purchase more stock such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, wheat flour, etc. for her kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Munkhsaikhan

texts.en:
Munkhsaikhan is 32 years old and married.  The entrepreneur lives with his spouse in a small apartment located in the local district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  Previously, he worked in Korea for four years. Today he operates a grocery store retail business with his wife Tsoomoo. 

They own a grocery store, which needs some capital to increase its working capital, so Munkhsaikhan is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase a variety of products for their small store. 

Munkhsaikhan is experienced in business and a very ambitious man who desires to expand his own business.

loans.use: to purchase more products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and blessed with a three -year-old child. She describes herself as a hardworking business woman. For the last five years, she has been running a tailoring business to support her family. She also does farming to increase her income.

In the next five years, she wants to buy another sewing machine.  

Since Christine joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business.  She is requesting for loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to add to her stock of fabric.

loans.use: to add to her stock of fabric.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Chanthy, 46, resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. Chanthy and her husband buy cows and buffalo to resell. Chanthy is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to travel to buy cows and buffalo to resell. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a 58 year-old woman. She is married and lives with her family (husband and three children). Her only son is a mason by profession, while her two daughters are involved in the sewing business. Their work is home based. All of her children contribute to the family financially from their earnings. 
Sakina’s days are focused on taking care of her family and managing her household work.  Her husband’s economic mainstay is selling animal skins. He supplies the animal skins to different factories which they use to make different products, like shoes and jackets, etc.  He has been operating his business for over 5 years and has had a good clientele. 

Sakina is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to purchase animal skins in larger quantity for re-selling.  She hopes that her husband will grow the business and improve the quality of services.  
Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sakina”.

loans.use: To buy animal skins for re-selling

loans.name: Salimjon

texts.ru: Салимджон занимается купле- продажей тканей. Более 2  лет он в этом бизнесе. Он активный и целеустремленный молодой парень. Он хочет зарабатывать много денег и мечтает расширить свой бизнес. Салимджон хотел бы получить займ в размере 800$ США для покупки нового ассортимента тканей для расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Salimjon sells fabrics at the market. He has been running his store for the last two years and is an energetic and goal oriented young man. He dreams about earning a lot of money and wants to expand his business. Salimjon would like to take out a loan of $800 US dollars to purchase new kinds of fabrics for his store, so that he can expand his client base. He is hoping for your support and would like to thank you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.en:
Janet is the facilitator of the Neema group. Janet and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Janet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Janet joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Janet had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Janet was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Janet will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Neema group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Janet with her group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ndusya

texts.en: Ndusya is married and blessed with five children, who are in school. She runs a retail shop business  to support her family. She has been in business for the last five years. She also does farming to supplement her income. Her potential customers are the local residents. Ndusya is requesting a loan of 62,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, rice and wheat flour for resale. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and wheat flour.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is requesting a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will buy spices, cooking oil, and other grocery items to be able to fulfill the client orders on time and increase his profits.  He is very fair in his rates and has been operating his business for the past many years. Khalida is hopeful that an investment will be helpful for her husband and it will grow his business.

She is a housewife and spends her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities.  She is the mother of 4 children. One of them works, while the others are getting their education from a nearby school.  She is very hopeful that her family will be able to live a better financial life as a result of her husband's improved business

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, spices, etc, for grocery store business

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wesakulila Group in Western Kenya! Esnus is the facilitator of the group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Esnus takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Esnus had a maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Esnus and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Esnus will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en: Osama is a 34 year-old young man.  He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Osama wants to help his two brothers, who are studying Business and Finance, to pay their university fees, so he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN.  When Osama gets the loan, he will pay the university fees for his two brothers so that they can continue their studies and get the first university degree.  This enables Osama to create a better future for his brothers. Osama is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for his two brothers.

loans.name: Sisina Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sisina Group in Western Kenya! Frida is the facilitator of the Sisina group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Frida  takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Frida had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Frida was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Frida and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Frida will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Sisina group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Frida and her group.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Chanthou, 41, resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. Chanthou and her husband buy frogs, chickens, ducks, rice, and vegetables to resell. Chanthou is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her son to commute to work. By doing so, her family will be able to decrease their expenses for public transportation. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to commute to work.

loans.name: Tum

texts.en:
Tum (in the photo), age 26, is single and lives with her parents and brothers and sisters in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her parents are rice farmers.

Tum is a garment worker. She is applying for a loan of $1,000 to assist in her parents’ rice farming business by buying rice seed and a pipe and water pumping machine.

loans.use: To assist in her parents’ rice farming business by buying rice seed and a pipe and water pumping machine.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario, is a 43-year-old entrepreneur and is married to Bernadeta, a 29-year-old lady. They are blessed with three children, namely: Thomas, 11, studying at the 1st grade of Elementary School; Melanie, 5, studying in kindergarten; and Stevania 3. Mario and wife originate from East Timor. They moved to West Timor in 1999.

To support his family, Mario is running a poultry business. He has been engaged in this business for three years. He initiated the business by raising 100 chicks. Since the business is growing well, Mario was able to raise more than 200 chicks in the coop. He recently sold the chickens after raising them for a month.

However Mario is thinking to add more chicks to be raised. He is sure that his chickens will be sold quickly, particularly on Christmas Day. For that reason, he is seeking the loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. He would like to purchase more chicks and feed for them. He also wants to enlarge the coop so it will be able to accommodate the additional chicks. Mario believes that the business income will enable him to support his children's education costs and to renovate his house as well.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 42 years old and married with seven children.  She lives in Hioma, Uganda.  She deals in the buying and selling of maize, rice and groundnuts and has been in this business for six years. She faces the challenge of customers not paying on time and having inadequate capital to purchase stock.  Her business goal is to diversify the business and her personal goals are to educate her children and build them a permanent house.

Doreen needs a loan to buy maize, rice and groundnuts for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize, rice and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал проживает в городе Конибодом. Возраст, 58 лет. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Акмал вместе с детьми занимается растениеводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается тридцать лет. Кредит берет для приобретения в аренду участка земли и посева озимой пшеницы.
texts.en: Akmal lives in Konibodom. He is 58 years old, married and has four children. Akmal grows produce with all four of his children and has been a farmer for the last 30 years. He is taking out this loan to rent a plot of land for growing winter wheat.

loans.use: to rent a plot of land and plant winter wheat

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is married and blessed with a three-year-old child who is in school.

He has been running a bookshop to make a living. He also does some farming work to increase his income. Dominic has been able to retain his business because he has a good reputation with his customers. He employs two people to assist him manage the business.

In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Through Faulu Kenya, he has gained business knowledge. With the requested loan in the amount of 20,000 KES, he plans to buy pens, pencils and printing paper for resale purposes.

loans.use: To purchase additional pens, pencils and printing paper

loans.name: Sophors

texts.en:
Sophors and her husband, Bunrat, have been married since 2008. They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. As you may be able to see from the picture, Sophors is pregnant.

The couple sells mangoes for a living. They purchase mango contracts from fellow villagers before the harvest season, and when the mangoes are harvested they carry them to sell at a market located in Phnom Penh.

Sophors is asking for another loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional mangoes for resale purposes.

loans.use: To purchase additional mangoes under contract for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman, age 23. She has been selling herbal medicine for the last year to make a living. She also runs a retail shop business to supplement her income. Esther has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy herbal medicine for resale. In the next 5 years, she plans to become the distributor of herbal medicine in her region.

loans.use: to buy herbal medicine

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en: Sophon resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. Sophon sells clothes, and her husband is a construction foreman. Sophon is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more fabrics to design clothes to sell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to design clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abdel Rahman

texts.en:
Abdel Rahman is a 34-year-old Lebanese man. He’s divorced, living with his only school-aged son and parents. 

Since he is the main income provider for his family, he started to work as a security in a local hotel in 2009 in addition to his job as a delivery man in one of the local restaurants for the past three years. 

Today, he decided to borrow $2,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his son’s educational fees until graduation. He’s devoting his life to his son and looking forward to offering him a respectable life.

loans.use: to pay his son’s educational fees until graduation.

loans.name: Huan

texts.en:
Huan is 51 years old. She is a member of Duc Lan cluster. She has four children. One of them is still small. 

Her main job is farming. She grows rice and also raises chickens. She has had this job for four years. She has a monthly income of about 5,500,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 6,496,000 VND and repaid punctually. This is her fifth loan from SEDA. This time she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Doeurn

texts.en:
Doeurn, age 44, and her husband, Chom, age 47, live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1991 and have one son and 6 daughters; 2 are garment workers, 2 attend school and the other 3 are still young.  

Doeurn and her husband are farmers. They grow tomatoes and corn on their farmland in the village where they live. Doeurn is asking for her first loan of 1,000 USD to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm. 

Photo: Doeurn is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm

loans.name: Tangati Women Group

texts.en:
Alice is the facilitator of the Tangati Women group. Alice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Alice joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tangati Women group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Alice with her group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.en:
Maria's group comprises two hard-working women. Maria is 20 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. For the past year, Maria has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Maria has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale, and it will help her to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Maria hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Maria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has improved Maria's future prospects by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale.

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has two children.

Karar has been an owner of a shop since 2009, selling women’s and kids' shoes. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has sufficient experience in this field. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of 2,400 USD in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Hussam

texts.en: Hussam is a 21-year-old single man. He has a scarfs and cosmetics shop which is his only source of income. Hussam wants to purchase a new collection of scarfs for the winter season and a better collection of cosmetics to resell and improve his income, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of 1,000 USD from FATEN. When Hussam gets the loan, he will pay to purchase a new collection of scarfs and cosmetics. Then he will have more items to compete and increase his sales and income to live in better conditions. Hussam is photographed in his shop.

loans.use: to purchase more scarfs and cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Khaka Group

texts.en:
Samson is the facilitator of the Khaka group. Samson and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Samson takes care of 11 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Samson had a good maize yield harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Samson was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Samson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Samson will educate his children and repay the loan.

In 2012, the members of Khaka group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

the picture shows Samson and his group with the field officer far right.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Bunthorn

texts.en:
Bunthorn and her husband, Nin, live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have two sons and three daughters; one is married and lives in a separate home, one is a garment worker, another one is in school and the other two assist their parents in the business.  

Bunthorn and her husband are farmers. They grow rice and vegetables on their farmland in the village where they live. Bunthorn is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

Photo: Bunthorn is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is 32 years old, married and lives with his two children in the village where he sows and gathers corn to sell. He wants to lift his family out of poverty. That's why he dedicates himself to his farming business. He works there every day to make sure that his business is in good hands.
 
Walter has managed his farming business for over five years and earned about PHP 17,000 from his previous crop. To exceed his profit, he needs to have enough financial assistance to operate his business. For this reason, Walter is requesting a loan amount of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, pesticides and fertilizers for his farm. He hopes to keep up his business to provide his family’s necessities as well as to secure their future.

loans.use: buy corn seeds, pesticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 40-year-old widow. She is living with two daughters,  Novi, 21, studying at a university, and Yunita, 17, studying in the 3rd grade of Senior High School.

Since the death of her husband 9 years ago, Rosalina automatically took over her husband’s role as the breadwinner for her family. To meet her family needs and her children's education needs, Rosalina is working at the church office as an administrator as well as running a rented house business (one simple house and 4 small rooms). She has been running the business for one year. Actually, she still has two more buildings for rent but the buildings are not completed yet due to her limited capital. 

Therefore Rosalina is seeking a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,500,000. The loan will be spent on building materials such as sand, cement, zinc, wood, etc. She is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as sand, cement, zinc, wood, etc.

loans.name: Monat

texts.ru: Монат жительница города Исфара. Возраст, 43 года. Образование – среднее. Замужем. У нее трое детей. Она более семи лет занимается производством. Монат печет лепешки для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа муки.
texts.en: Monat lives in the city of Isfara. She has finished high school and is 43 years old. Monat is married and has three children. For the last seven years she has been working as a baker, making traditional Tajik bread for sale. Monat is taking out this loan to purchase a big batch of flour wholesale.

loans.use: top purchase flour

loans.name: Theavy

texts.en:
Theavy resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. 

Theavy and her husband sell clothes. Theavy is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more clothes to resell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is married and blessed with three children who are in school. He has been practicing both crop and dairy farming for the last twenty years to support his family. He has employed two people to assist him manage his business. He is requesting for a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a cow. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Idibek

texts.ru: Более 25 лет Идибек занимается купле- продажей бычков и имеет богатый опыт. Он покупает скот на центральном рынке, а потом продает на местном рынке. Данный бизнес он начал для того чтобы создать своим детям хорошие условия. Идибек хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль для улучшения благосостояния семьи. Идибек запрашивает займ для покупки скота и корма для них. Он надеется на вашу помощь, который позволит ему осуществить его мечту.
texts.en: Idibek has been involved in buying and selling bulls for over 25 years and has a rich experience in this field.  He buys livestock at the central market and then sells it at a local market.  He started this business so that he could provide good conditions for his children.  Idibek wants to expand his business and make a good profit to improve his family's welfare.  Idibek is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock and fodder for it.  He hopes to get your help, which will allow him to achieve his dream.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fodder for it

loans.name: Musaka Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Musaka SHG Group in Western Kenya! Fitea is the facilitator of the Musaka SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Fitea takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Fitea had a good maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Fitea and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012.
