Diestoria hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothing for resale in her business.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Magbéfon est une femme âgé(e) de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un  topographe et a 06 enfants.
Magbéfon travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes et divers depuis 2001. Elle vend à ses clients à domicile. Ses achats se font à Lomé.
Magbéfon a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes.
Dans les prochaines années, Magbéfon voudrait ouvrir une boutique afin de répondre plus à la demande de la clientèle.
texts.en: Magbéfon is a 40-year old woman who is married to a surveyor and has six children. She has been working as a retailer of "pagnes" (pieces of brightly coloured fabric) and other items since 2001. She sells to her customers from home and buys her goods in Lomé. Magbéfon has been granted her fourth loan from WAGES in order to be able to buy "pagnes". In the coming years, she would like to open a shop in order to be able to meet client demand more readily.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes" and other items

loans.name: Ziyadin

texts.ru: Зиядину 45 лет, женат, счастливый отец пятерых детей.  В поисках средств дохода для своей семьи, в 1995 году Зиядин начал свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Зиядина, начатое с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  сегодня приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) раз в три  месяца от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Зиядин обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и бычков. Доходы от кредита Зиядин планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Ziyadin is 45 years old, married and a proud father of five children. In search of income for his family in 1995 Ziyadin began his business in fattening cattle and reselling it. Because of the tenacity and perseverance Ziyadin's business which started with the sum of 10,000 soms (KGS) today brings about 20,000 som (KGS) every three months from the sale of meat and dairy products. In order to further increase the number of livestock Ziyadin has come to the company Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 70,000 KGS to purchase a cow and bulls. Ziyadin plans to invest the profit from the loan to further increase in the number of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Angaza Women Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Angaza Women Group in Western Kenya! Velima is the facilitator of the Angaza Women group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Velima takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Velima had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Velima was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Velima and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Velima will educate her children and ensure food security for her family in the future.

In 2012, the members of Angaza Women Group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Velima with her group members and the field officer who is standing at the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine used her first loan to buy more goats, which she reared and sold. 

She has applied for a second loan of KES 10,000, with which she will buy more goats to rear and sell later at a profit. 

She hopes to succeed in the future.

loans.use: To buy more goats for sale.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 48-year-old married woman with one son and one daughter. She has a beauty salon, which is her sole source of income. Her daughter also works with her in the salon. 
Sawsan wants to make some repairs to her salon, such as painting, changing the windows and the door, etc. She also wants to purchase a beauty salon kit (such as hair creams and shampoo, hairdryers, different types of hairbrush, etc.) in order to improve her work. She does not have sufficient funds for this, so she wants to take a loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner FATEN. When Sawsan receives the loan, she will make the necessary repairs to her beauty salon and purchase a new beauty salon kit. This will enable her to improve her salon and work to satisfy her customers and increase her income. 
Sawsan is a conservative woman, so her daughter is photographed in the salon instead.

loans.use: to make some repairs and purchase a beauty salon kit.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, 42, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Roberto, a welder, and a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Imelda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 38,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Imelda hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ramazana

texts.en:
Ramazana is a 51-year-old farmer from the village of Chantlikure, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Maisarat, his 21-year-old son and his daughter-in-law. Ramazana’s son has just married. 
Ramazana and Maisarat lead the agricultural activities of the family. They grow vegetables on a family-owned plot of land. The family also has beehives with bee colonies. They sell harvested honey locally. They also sell harvested fruits and vegetables locally. The family's total average monthly income is 600 GEL. 
Ramazana has requested credit to purchase a wedding gift for his son and daughter-in-law. Maisarat will assist him in selection of the gift.

loans.use: to purchase a wedding gift for his son and daughter-in law.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last nine years. He is 38 years old, married to Ann, and they have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer as well as farm inputs for use in his farm.

In future, Elijah hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer seeds and farm inputs.

loans.name: Muslima

texts.ru: Муслима замужем и имеет двоих детей. Её муж работает бухгалтером в «Барки Точик», а она имеет магазин рядом городской больницей. Он взяла эту точку в аренду и занимается продажей хозяйственных товаров. Более трех лет она в этом бизнесе и хочет расширить его. Муслима хотела бы получить займ на сумму 3000 Сомони для расширения своего бизнеса, чтобы максимизировать свою прибыль. Она заранее благодарна всем кредиторам за их доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Muslima is married and has two children. Her husband works as an accountant for the power company Barki Tochik, and she has a shop near the city hospital. She is leasing the shop where she sells household goods. She's been in this business for more than three years, and she wants to expand it. Muslima would like to take out a loan for 3,000 somoni to expand her business and maximize her profit. She would like to thank all of the lenders in advance for their kindness and help.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Magbéfon

texts.fr:
Magbéfon est une femme âgé(e) de 26 ans. Elle est mariée à un  photographe. Elle est mère de 02 enfants. 
Magbéfon travaille comme revendeuse d’alimentation générales et produits congelés depuis 2000. Elle vend à domicile et achète ses produits à Lomé. 
Magbéfon a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits congelés et des produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Magbéfon is 26 years old. She is married to a photographer, and is the mother of two children.

Magbéfon has been working as a retail merchant of grocery products and frozen foods. She sells from her home and gets her supplies in Lomé.

Magbéfon requested her second WAGES credit loan to buy frozen food and grocery products.

loans.use: Buy grocery products and frozen foods

loans.name: Norbobo

texts.ru: Норбобо житель города Вахдат. Возраст, 51 год. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Он пекарь, печет лепешки для продажи. Вместе с ним работают двое людей, которые помогают ему. Он берет кредит для покупки муки и угля.
texts.en: Norbobo lives in Vahdat. He is 51 years old, married, and has two children. He is a baker. He bakes and sells flat breads. He has two people working for him. He is taking out a loan to buy flour and coal.

loans.use: to buy flour and coal.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old and married with two children.

Raed has had a barber shop since 2008. He offers haircuts and shaves and trims beards. He has significant experience in this field and a deep understanding of local consumers. He is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $1,200 loan to purchase a generator, television and satellite for his shop. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring positive growth.

loans.use: To purchase generator, television and satellite for his shop.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 26 years old, married and a father of two children. He is a fish monger and has been in the business for the last three years, with a monthly profit of KES 6,000. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer, and he is applying for his second loan of KES 30,000 from the company, which he plans to use to add additional stock of fish for selling. 

The client will save the anticipated profit as he continues to support his family. In the future, Josphat hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To add fish stock for sale.

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr:
Améyo est une femme âgé(e) de 30 ans. Elle est mariée å un peintre auto et ont ensemble 05 enfants.
Améyo travaille comme revendeuse de maïs, haricot, de mil depuis 2005. Elle vend dans un marché de la place et s’approvisionne à TSEVIE(une localité située à quelques kilomètres de la ville de Lomé).
Améyo a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du maïs, du haricot de la farine et autres.
texts.en:
Améyo is a 30 year old woman.  She is married to an automobile painter and together they have 5 children. 
Améyo has been selling corn, beans and millet since 2005.  She sells at the market in her area and gets her supplies in Tsevie (a town located a few kilometers from Lomé).  
Améyo has received her first loan through WAGES in order to buy corn, beans, flour, and other items.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, millet and other items.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. He is 41 years old, married to Eunice and they have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings for use in his farm during this planting season.

In the future, Francis hopes to improve his farming skills and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area. He hopes to increase his income, thereby improving his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.ru: Файзулло житель города Куляб. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат. Имеет пятерых детей. Он занимается торговлей фруктов. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Fayzullo lives in Kulob. He is 26 years old, married, and has five children. He sells fruit. He is taking out a loan to increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy tangerines, oranges, and kiwi.

loans.name: Naseem Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Naseem Bibi is 41 years old and lives with her five children, four of whom are getting an education from a local school while the fifth works. Naseem’s days are focused on taking care of her family and raising her children.  
Naseem's husband runs a store where he sells basic household products. He has been in this business for over ten years. All his neighbors and friends from his area are customers. He earns a decent income every month from his business.   
Naseem is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy oil, lentils, rice, spices, etc. This will increase her husband's stock and will help him to improve his customer service. Naseem is hopeful that the financial condition of her husband’s business will be improved a lot after the loan investment.
In the photo, the lady holding the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Naseem Bibi.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her husband's grocery store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service her motorcycle and open a salon.

loans.name: Dariimaa

texts.en:
Dariimaa is a 28-year-old educated woman who lives with her parents in an outer ger district, which lacks basic infrastructure, of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 
Dariimaa has been working as a head of “Scholarship Education” training center since 2008. Her training center’s mission is to create opportunities and to place students on scholarship programs. The center also manages foreign language training. In 2010, Dariimaa published her first book. Today she plans to republish the second edition. So she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 Mongolian Turgriks (MNT) to publish this edition. 
In the photograph, the book that Dariimaa is holding is the second edition draft. Dariimaa is a very hardworking and ambitious young lady who desires to give teenagers an opportunity to obtain a world-class education.

loans.use: to publish the second edition of her book.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 32 years old and married.  She owns a clothing shop, which she has owned since February 2011. Fatima started her new business after she  working in a clothing factory, in order to improve her living conditions with a business of her own.  In addition to clothes, Fatima sells cosmetics, accessories, and shoes, which she believes attracts customers' attention to other items.

Fatima is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to buy new autumn and winter shoes and clothes collection, as well as cosmetics and accessories with special designs.  These new items will help attract new customers and increase her sales and income.

Fatima is a woman with good reputation, a hard worker who seeks perfection. She hopes to expand her business in the future through moving to a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new autumn and winter collection.

loans.name: Marum

texts.en:
Mariam is 24 years old, married, and has three children. She is a tailor, which she has been doing for 11 years. She earns a monthly profit of 5,000 KES. 

Mariam is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD for 21,000 KES, which she will use to buy additional stock of cloth material and embroidery materials. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

Mariam will save the anticipated profit to help pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into a full boutique.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cloth and embroidery material.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. He is 25 years old, married to Ann, and they have one child.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more cattle to boost his milk production as well as his farming.

In the future, John hopes to become a major dairy farmer and one of the leading distributors of milk to the milk-producing companies in Ndunyu Njeru and other towns.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle.

loans.name: Bidii Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii SHG Group in Western Kenya! Joan is the facilitator of the Bidii SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joan takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Joan had an excellent maize yield harvesting 25 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Joan was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joan and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Joan will educate her children and invest in business.

In 2012, the members of Bidii SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Lewa

texts.en:
Lewa is 26 years old, married and a father of two children. He is in the transport business, which he has been doing for last six years. He earns a monthly profit of 20,000 KES. 

Lewa is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD for 30,000 KES, which he will use to service his matatu (minibus).  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. 

Lewa will save the anticipated profit as he continues to support his family. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and own a fleet of vehicles.

loans.use: To service his matatu (minibus).

loans.name: Nigor

texts.ru: Нигор житель города Вахдат. Возраст, 35 лет. Замужем, имеет пятерых детей. Образование – среднее. Она занимается торговлей. В этой области она семь лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Nigor is a resident of the city of Vahdat.  She is 35 years old, married and has five children.  She has a secondary education.  Nigor is involved in sales and has been in this business for seven years.  She is requesting this loan to increase product turnover.

loans.use: to increase product turnover

loans.name: Anjela

texts.en:
Anjela is single and blessed with two children who are in school. She describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman. She employs one person to assist her in the business. Since Anjela joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. With her loan of 20,000 KES, she intends to buy vegetables, fruits, and potatoes for resale. 
In the next five years, Angjela wants to expand her business. She dreams of buying a van for transporting fruits and vegetables to the market.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits and potatoes.

loans.name: Leon

texts.en:
Leon is 45 years of age, an optimistic, jolly and industrious farmer in their community. He said that,"we should be positive and happy always though there are a lot of trials that we encounter every day" and maybe this is the reason why looks younger than his real age.

He wants to develop more his business because he is dreaming to finish his three children in their studies. This lead him to ask a loan amount P15,000 to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. This loan would be a big help in growing his business plus his patience and hard work. He believe that when he work  hard and trust our creator, he would then achieve success.

Hopefully, he could uplift his family out of poverty and secure their future.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single and lives with two family members who all work.

Ali is a plumber. In 2005, he opened his workshop. His business offers a service for installing and maintaining systems used for potable drinking water, sewage, and drainage in plumbing systems. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to expand his workshop by renting the shop next to him. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring positive business growth.

loans.use: to expand his workshop by renting the shop next to him.

loans.name: Marziya

texts.ru: Марзие 49 лет. Она работает учителем кыргызского языка и литературы в школе города Исфана. В связи с тем, что заработная плата учителей низкая,   в 2010 году, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода, Марзия начала заниматься торговлей детской и подростковой одеждой на местном рынке. Она арендовала контейнер (торговое место) и открывает его каждый день во второй половине дня, совмещая бизнес с основной работой. Хороший ассортимент товара Марзии, приветливое обслуживание, практичные советы при подборе одежды привлекают  все больше и больше клиентов. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Марзия обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров за счет закупа одежды зимнего периода.   Доходы от кредита Марзия планирует направить на дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Marziya is 49 years old.  She works as a Kyrgyz language and literature teacher at a school in the town of Isfana.  Due to the fact teachers' salaries are low and to find an additional source of income, she decided to start her own business of selling children's and teenage clothing at a local market in 2010.  She leased a container (retail space) and opens it every day during the second half of the day, thus, combining her business with her primary job.  Marziya's good selection of merchandise, friendly service and practical advice with clothing choice attract more and more customers.  In order to further grow her business, Marziya requested a loan in the sum of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand merchandise assortment by purchasing winter seasonal merchandise.  She plans to direct the profits from this loan to continued business expansion.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Sharkiya

texts.ru: Шаркия замужем, любящая мать двоих детей. Более 10 лет она занимается купле- продажей овощей на местном рынке. Она всегда привозит свежие овощи на продажу. Она хочет обеспечить своих детей и устроить их в хорошие школы и высшие учебные заведения, с этой целью она допоздна работает, чтобы заработать больше средств. Шаркия хотела бы получить займ для оптовой  покупки свежих овощей. Она надеется на ваше понимание и ждет вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Sharkiya is married and a loving mother of two children. For over 10 years, she has sold vegetables at the local market, always bringing fresh produce for sale. Sharkiya wants to provide for her children so that they can study in good schools and get a higher education, and often works late in order to maximize her earnings. She has requested a loan to purchase fresh vegetables wholesale. She hopes for Kiva lenders' understanding and support.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Naem

texts.en:
Naem is a 26-year-old young man. He has a workshop for maintaining computers to resell. His father is a construction worker with a decent salary. 
Naem wants to purchase a new maintenance kit to improve the quality of his work; he also wants to expand his work by purchasing more computers to maintain and resell, in order to increase his income. However, the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. 
When Naem gets the loan, he will be able to expand and improve his workshop by purchasing a new kit and more computers. He will be able to compete well and increase his sales and income and therefore live in better conditions. Naem is photographed in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a new maintenance kit and more computers to repair and resell.

loans.name: Navruz

texts.ru: Навруз проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Навруз занимается изготовлением деревянной национальной посуды из дерева (табаки чуби). Этим видом деятельности он занимается четыре года. Он берет кредит для приобретения сырья.
texts.en: Navruz lives in the city of Vahdat.  He is 28 years old, married and has two children.  Navruz is involved in making national wooden dishware (tabaki chubi).  He has been in this business for four years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of raw materials.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a married man, aged 26. He operates a van transport business to make a living. He also sells used clothes to earn an extra income. He works hard in his business, in order to provide for his family.   
Since Gabriel joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. He has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of clothes for resale.

loans.use: To add to his stock of clothes.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 28 years old, married and has a child who is one and a half years old. For the last three years, he has earned a living by selling hardware and tools, and earns an income of about KES 15,000 a month. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to our organization by a friend. He plans to use the loan to buy more hardware to sell to his customers. He will use the additional profits made possible by this loan to invest in his business. His goals for the future is to become more finally stable by expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy more hardware to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en:
Bassem is a 51-year-old Lebanese man. He is married and lives with his wife and three school-aged children. He is the main source of income for the family and does his best to fulfill their needs. 

He has been working as a taxi driver for the past five years, responding to customers' requests.  

Today he is requesting a loan of $2900 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to carry out necessary maintenance on his car, including welding and painting. This will certainly facilitate his business and allow him to attract more clients. 

In the future, he plans to buy a new van and organize trips for tourists.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on his car such as welding and painting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bananas, mangoes, and pineapples.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is married and blessed with three children who are in school. She has been practising dairy farming for the last five years to support her family. She employs one person to assist her in managing the business. 
Philomena is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a dairy cow. In the next five years, she plans to buy a piece of land. Thanks to Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, Philomena has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: For the last seven years, Monica has earned a living as a farmer in the town of Ndunyu Njeru.  She is 23 years old, married and has one child, who is currently enrolled in school. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our clients and is applying her first loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and seeds as well as hire a worker to help her on her farm. In the future, Monica hopes to improve her skills and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair braids and renovate her business premises.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
13 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní se unieron con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos por medio del trabajo en conjunto, y gracias al  apoyo de las unas con las otras. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy emprendedoras.
Blanca es una de las miembros, quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo. Comenta que todos los días se levanta muy temprano para preparar  los alimentos que vende. Dice que tiene muy buena clientela, lo que la ayuda con sus ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, jamón, queso, hortalizas y demás insumos necesarios. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
13 women from the city of Santaní got together with the objective of improving their incomes through working together and supporting each other. They are hard working, fighters who are very enterprising.  

Blanca is one of the members, and she sells all types of food. She remarks that every day she gets up very early to prepare the food she sells. She says she has a good clientele and that helps with her income.   

She is asking for the loan to buy meat, ham, cheese, vegetables and other necessary ingredients. She is thankful to the institution and Kiva for the opportunity they have given her.

loans.use: to buy meats, ham, cheese, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Talente Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Talente Group in Western Kenya! Evelyn is the facilitator of the Talente group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Evelyn takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Evelyn had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Evelyn was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Evelyn and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Evelyn will educate her children and repay her loans.

In 2012, the members of Talente group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Habib

texts.ru:
Хабиб заёмщик в возрасте 71 года, житель Джамоата Исмоиль, занимается откормом скота. У него семеро детей, шесть сыновей и одна дочь. У Хабиба 12 внуков, двое из которых помогают деду. Помимо животноводства он получает пенсию 100 сомони. Отцу помогает также его старший сын, с которым живёт Хабиб со своей женой. За пять лет кредитования он ни разу не нарушил условия организации и благодарен инвесторам за поддержку. 
Получив кредит в сумме 100 сомони, он хочет купить комбикорм для своего скота.
texts.en: Habib is a 71 year-old borrower and a resident of Jamoat Ismoil, who is involved in fattening up livestock.  He has seven children - six sons and one daughter.  Habib has 12 grandchildren, two of whom help their grandfather.  Besides animal husbandry, he receives a pension of 100 somoni.  His oldest son, with whom Habib and his wife live, also helps him with the business.  Over the five years of credit history, Habib has not once violated terms of the organization, and he is grateful to the investors for support.  He wants to use the loan in the sum of 100 somoni to buy livestock feed.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Фирдавс активный и целеустремленный юноша. Три года назад он открыл свой бизнес и стал успешен. Он продает мужскую обувь на местном рынке. Он имеет постоянных клиентов и хочет привлечь еще новых клиентов. Для этого он хочет добавить новый ассортимент обуви для разнообразия товара. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 800$ США. Он надеется на вашу помощь, и благодарит вас за ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Firdavs is an active and goal-oriented young man.  He opened his own business three years ago and became successful.  He sells men's shoes at the local market.  Firdavs has loyal customers and wants to attract even more new customers.  For this, he wants to add a new assortment of shoes to vary his merchandise.  This is why he is requesting a loan in the sum of $800.  Firdavs hopes to get your help and thanks you for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of shoes

loans.name: Zylal

texts.ru: Зылал 59 лет, вдова и имеет одного сына.  В поисках источника существования для своей семьи, в 1998 года, Зылал начала свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота.  На сегодняшний день хозяйство, начатое с суммы в 19,000 сом (KGS), приносит около 13,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов.   В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Зылал обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Зылал планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья домашнего скота.
texts.en: Zylal is 59 years old, a widow and has one son.  In search of a source of survival for her family, Zylal started her own business of fattening up and reselling livestock in 1998.  Today her business, which was started with a sum of 19,000 som (KGS), brings in about 13,000 som (KGS) per month from the sales of dairy and meat products.  In order to further increase her livestock quantity, Zylal requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase bulls.  She plans to invest the profits from this loan into further increasing livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Khayrullo

texts.ru: Хайрулло занимается развозкой людей по маршруту Вахдат – Душанбе. Ему 22 года. В этой области он год. Кредит берет для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Khayrullo is involved in transporting passengers along the Vahdat - Dushanbe route.  He is 22 years old.  He has been in this business for one year.  Khayrullo is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 47-year-old, married man with four children. He sells chicken, a business he has been in for eight years.  Mahmoud's customers approve of his good quality products. 

To improve his business, Mahmoud requests a loan from KIVA partner Al Majmoua.  He will use the loan to buy a new car for his business.  The car will help Mahmoud transport requested products from wholesale stores to his shop.  Mahmoud received a previous loan from Al Majmoua and it helped to increase his capital, which in turn led to his ability to respond to an increased number of customer needs.  Mahmoud is in good standing as a borrower.

loans.use: To buy a car to transport wholesale chicken products to his shop for sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married and blessed with two children who are in school. For the last three years, he has been selling medicines. He also sells eggs to earn extra income. Peter employs two people to assist him in the business. He has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. 
Peter has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy medicines. In the next five years, he wants to establish a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new cooking equipment for her home business

loans.name: Mosa

texts.en:
Mosa is a 49-year-old married man with three sons and one daughter. One of his sons is an employee, the other two are workers with decent salaries, and his daughter is a university student. 
Mosa has a store for selling used home appliances. He wants to expand his business by purchasing and collecting used home appliances in bulk. He has insufficient funds, so he wants to take a loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner FATEN. When Mosa receives the loan, he will be able to expand his store by collecting more used home appliances for resale. This will enable him to compete well, increase his sales and income, and so provide better living conditions for his family. 
Mosa is photographed in his store.

loans.use: to purchase used home appliances in bulk.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a 33-year-old, married woman with six children between the ages of 2 and 15 years old.  Three of her children are in school.  Joice has operated a food stall business in Buluk, South Sudan for five years.

Joice requested a loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread, tomatoes, and onions for her food stall. She will use the extra income she earns as a result of the loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase bread, tomatoes, and onions for sale at her food stall business.

loans.name: Patricia's Group

texts.en:
Patricia's group is comprised of two hard working women. Patricia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero Region of Uganda. For the past year, Patricia has worked hard to manage her small market where she sells food. 

To help expand her business, Patricia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food for resale and will help Patricia to generate greater profits.  She will use the profits to pay for her own school fees.  Patricia hopes to become a teacher in the future. 

Patricia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum on life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Patricia's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food for resale at a small market

loans.name: Nurulo

texts.ru: Нуруло предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он три года. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. Уже три года как предоставляет услугу. Он развозит пассажиров по маршруту Вахдат – Душанбе. Кредит берет для ремонта машины.
texts.en: Nurulo provides a taxi service.  He has been in this business for three years.  Nurulo is 40 years old and married.  He has been providing this service for three years and transports passengers along the Vahdat - Dushanbe route.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru: На снимке мужчина 37 лет, Мукимчон. Он торгует фруктами в центре города Худжанда на рынке Панчшанбе. Мукимчон закупает товар у оптовиков, и его ассортимент составляет бананы, яблоки, мандарины, груши и т.п. Его жена работает учительницей в средней школе и её заработная плата составляет всего 300 сомони  в месяц, что не хватает на жизнь. Сам Мукимчон, кроме розничной торговли, также занимается оптовой перепродажей крупных партий фруктов с рук дехкан в руки торговцев фруктами в розницу. Его доход с розничной продажи очень маленьки, поэтому он хочет увеличить на следующий кредит 500 сомони  он хочет под новый год завезти разновидности цитрусовых фруктов и бананов.
texts.en: The photograph shows a 37 year-old man, Mukimchon.  He sells fruits at the Panchshanbe market in the city center of Khujand.  Mukimchon buys his product from wholesalers, and his selection includes bananas, apples, tangerines, pears and the like.  His wife works as a teacher at a secondary school, and her salary amounts to only 300 somoni per month, which is not enough for life.  Besides retail sales, Mukimchon is also involved in wholesale resale of large inventories of fruits from dekhan farmers to retail sellers of fruits.  His income from the retail sales is very small, and he wants to increase his income.  He wants to use his next loan of 500 somoni to bring in varieties of citrus fruits and bananas before the New Year's.

loans.use: to purchase citrus fruits and bananas

loans.name: Khalunyanu B Group

texts.en:
Jacktone is the facilitator of the Khalunyanu B group. Jacktone and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jacktone takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Jacktone had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jacktone was only able to harvest 4 ½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jacktone and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Jacktone will educate his children and build a house for his family.

In 2012, the members of Khalunyanu B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Jacktone is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Раъно заёмщица «Арванд» с 2002 года, которая берёт каждый кредит на расширении своего товарооборота. Вначале своей кредитной истории она занималась мелкой  торговлей, продавала мужские и женские носки и нижнее белья, и её оборот составлял всего 120 долларов. Сейчас ее товарооборот увеличился и достиг 1500 долларов. Она изменила ассортимент продаваемых товаров на спортивную мужскую одежду, а также и место торговли. Товар привозит из Бишкека раз в месяц.  Муж Раъно работает продавцом в магазине по продаже ковров и паласов. Его ежемесячная заработная плата составляет 700 сомони и он полностью обеспечивает семью. У них трое детей, из которых один учится в ВУЗе, поэтому из своей прибыли Раъно старается  ежегодно оплачивать договорную плату за обучение. На получаемый кредит Раъно собирается увеличить ассортимент утеплённой сезонной одежды.
texts.en: Rano has been a borrower with Arvand since 2002 and took out each one of her loans in order to increase her good turnover.  At the beginning of her credit history, she was involved in small sales and sold men's and women's socks and undergarments, and her goods turnover amounted to only 120 dollars.  Currently, her goods turnover increased and reached 1500 dollars.  She changed her merchandise selection to men's athletic clothing and also changed her place of business.  Rano brings in merchandise from Bishkek once per month.  Her husband works as a salesperson at a rugs and carpet store.  His monthly income is 700 somoni, and fully provides for the family.  They have three children, one of whom studies at a university, and this is why Rano tries to use her profits to pay the agreed tuition for the education annually.  Rano plans to use this loan to expand the selection of warm seasonal clothing.

loans.use: to expand selection of warm seasonal clothing

loans.name: Cissy's Group

texts.en:
Cissy's group includes three hard-working women. Cissy is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero Region of Uganda. For the past two years, Cissy has worked hard to manage her poultry farm from which she sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan of 450,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy chicken for resale and will help Cissy generate greater profits.  She will use the profits to buy food and cover other family expenses. Cissy hopes to expand her business in the future. 

Cissy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Cissy's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken for resale,

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a 40-year-old married woman with four sons and three daughters. Her husband is a worker with a decent salary. 
Fatema has a grocery store and she wants to buy a greater variety of groceries to resell, but she hasn't sufficient funds. Therefore she wants to take a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner FATEN. When Fatema receives the loan, she will be able to purchase more groceries and offer a better variety for sale. This will increase her income and enable her to offer better living conditions to her family.
Fatema is a conservative woman, so her 18-year-old son is photographed in the grocery store instead.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell in her store.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is 30 years old and married to a businesswoman. For the last three years, he has made a living by selling mobile phone accessories and money transfer services. He earns about KES 15,000 in a month and supplements this income by charging and repairing phones. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to our organization by a friend. He plans to use the loan to expand his business. His goal for the future is to become finally stable by opening a large store that sells mobile accessories.

loans.use: to expand a mobile phone business.

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr:
Amah est une femme  âgé(e) de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un électricien auto avec 03 enfants en charge.
Amah travaille comme revendeuse de produits cosmétiques et divers depuis 1999. Elle vend dans un quartier de la place et est aidée par une personne. 
Amah a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits cosmétiques et divers.
texts.en:
Amah is a 36 year old woman.  She is married to an automotive electrician and they have three children in their care.
Amah has been selling cosmetics and various products since 1999.  She sells in a local neighborhood and has one person who helps her. 
Amah received her first loan through WAGES in order to buy cosmetics and various products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and general grocery products.

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Rebecca is 19 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. For the past two years, Rebecca has been working hard to selling charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca is requesting a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, which she will use to buy more charcoal to sell. This loan will help her generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to become a nurse. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Rebecca's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Juddy

texts.en:
Juddy is married and blessed with two children who are in school. She has been running a beauty salon to make a living for the last five years. She  employs one person to assist her in the business. She has retained her business because of her hard work and determination.  
Juddy has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy hair chemicals and a blow-dry machine. She expresses gratitude to Kiva partner Faulu Kenya because she has been able to adopt the culture of saving. In the next five years, she plans to open a hairdressing school.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals and a blow-dry machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in cloth.

loans.name: Altanbagana

texts.en:
Altanbagana is a 33-year-old man who lives with his two children and wife in an outer ger district without basic infrastructure in the city of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He works for a local company while his children attend secondary school and kindergarten. His wife stays at home to look after their children. 
Last year, Altanbagana bought a new plot of land for 1,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT). He is planning to build a new house on this plot next spring, so he is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials. 
Altanbagana is a trusted client of Kiva partner Transcapital Company Ltd.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru:
Чолпон 39 лет, замужем, воспитывает четырех детей, младшие из которых школьники. Муж находится на заработках в соседнем Казахстане, где работает на стройке.  В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2006 году Чолпон начала свой бизнес в торговле овощами и фруктами. Стартовав с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS), Чолпон благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  около 20,000 сом (KGS). Она закупает фрукты, а также продукцию в виде яблок, помидоров, перца у местных производителей по оптовой цене, затем продает на местном рынке.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпон обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Чолпон планирует вложить в  расширение торгового места.
texts.en: Cholpon is 39 years old, married and is raising four children, the youngest of whom are school students.  Her husband works in the neighboring Kazakhstan at a construction site.  In search of an additional source of income for her family, Cholpon started her business of selling vegetables and fruits in 2006.  Having started with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS), Cholpon was able to develop her business to have a monthly income of about 20,000 som (KGS), thanks to her persistence and hard work.  She buys fruits and produce, such as apples, tomatoes and peppers from local producers at wholesale prices and then sell the produce at a local market.  In order to further grow her business, Cholpon requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand her product selection.  She plans to invest the profits from this loan into an expansion of her retail space.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar and general merchandise.

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.ru: Фахриддин целеустремленный и добросовестный юноша. Он хотел начать свой бизнес и пять лет назад он стал заниматься купле- продажей скота. Он является владельцем данного бизнеса. Фахриддин хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Fakhriddin is a goal-oriented and conscientious young man.  He wanted to start his own business and became involved in buying and selling livestock five years ago.  He is the owner of this business.  Fakhriddin wants to expand his business and maximize his profit.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 to purchase livestock and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 30 year old, married, and has four children, all of whom attend school. She has a food stall business selling food in Buluk, South Sudan, which she has been doing for five years.

Hellen is requesting a loan from BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase tomatoes, onions, and cooking oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onion, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Kibisi Group

texts.en:
Elder is the facilitator of the Kibisi group. Elder and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Elder takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Elder had an excellent maize yield harvesting 17 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Elder was only able to harvest 5½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elder and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Elder will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kibisi group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Esther is 21 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, Esther has been working hard to manage her pig farm, which sells pigs. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more pigs for resale, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and pay her child's school fees. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Esther's future prospects by helping her improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for resale.

loans.name: Katui

texts.en:
Katui is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She has been running a beauty salon for the last two years in order to make a living. She also does farming to supplement her income. Katui employs one person to assist her in managing the business. She has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. 
Katui is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy hair braids, weaves, hair chemicals and a hairdryer. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy hair braids, weaves, hair chemicals and a hairdryer.

loans.name: Mulimani Group

texts.en:
.Greetings from Mulimani Group in Western Kenya! Juliana is the facilitator of the Mulimani group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Juliana takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Juliana had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Juliana was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Juliana and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Juliana will educate her children and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Mulimani group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Juliana with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 21 years old, single, and has one child who attends school.  She lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. For the past three years, Edith has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Edith is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, which she will use to buy more clothes to sell. This loan will help Edith generate greater profits and pay school fees for her son. Edith hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Edith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Edith's future prospects by helping her to lending her money that has increased the capital of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bamtare Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 09/05/2011.IL est composé de 30 membres issus du même village.
Mme Hassatou,en position debout à l'extreme droite et levant la main, est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 44 ans, est mariée et s'occupe de 02 enfants.

Son activité est le petit commerce de condiments pour la cuisine (ail, poivre, oignon, sel etc) En plus de cela à ses heures perdues,elle fait du maraichage pour diversifier ses activités.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité,dufait qu'elle la pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Son pret lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises (ail, poivre, oignon, sel etc)

Son objectif est  d'assurer la scolarité ,la nourriture et la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on September 5, 2011.  It is made up of 30 members who live in the same village.
Mrs. Hassatou, standing to the extreme right with her hand raised, is the leader of the group.  She is 44 years old, married, and cares for two children.
She is involved in sales of condiments (garlic, pepper, onion, salt, etc).  In addition to this, in her free time, she sells products from her garden at the market in order to diversify her work. 
She has gained good experience in this line of work because she has been doing it for several years. 
Her loan will allow her to stock up on merchandise. 
Her goal is to assure education, food, and health care for her children.

loans.use: to buy garlic, pepper, onions, salt, and other condiments for resale

loans.name: Marziyai

texts.ru: Марзияи замужем, ей 20 лет. Она занимается пошивом женских национальных платьев. Более 3 лет  она занимается этим ремеслом. Её муж является рабочим. Марзияи принимает заказы на   пошив женских национальных платьев. Она имеет много клиентов и её соседи также ей заказывают пошив платьев. Она шьет красиво. Марзияи запрашивает займ для покупки тканей для пошива платьев. Она надеется на вашу помощь и благодарит вас за ваше понимание.
texts.en: Marziyai is 20 years old.  She is involved in sewing women's national dresses.  She has been in this business for over three years.  Her husband is a worker.  Marziyai accepts order to sew women's national dresses.  She has many clients, and also her neighbors order dresses from her.  She sews beautifully.  Marziyai is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics for sewing dresses.  She hopes to get your help and thanks you for your understanding.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase blankets, clothes, and shoes.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni is a 29 year old a married woman with four children between the ages of twelve and five. All of them are in school. For the past five years she has had a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan. 

Poni requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. In the future, she will use the extra income she gets from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase clothes and footwear.

loans.name: Jua Welfare Group

texts.en:
Akoinasi is the facilitator of the Jua Welfare group. Akoinasi and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Akoinasi is a father of three children. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, he had a good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Akoinasi and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from his maize sales, he will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Jua Welfare group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a determined businessman, aged 36. He is married and blessed with three children, all of whom are in school. For the last six years, he has been running a hardware business to support his family. He also does farming to increase his income. He employs one person to assist him in managing the business. 
John is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy paints, spanners, bolts and nuts. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy paints, spanners, bolts and nuts.

loans.name: Rahmatsho

texts.ru: Рахматшо проживает в районе Данагара. Ему 31 год. Он женат. Более пяти лет Рахматшо печет и продает самбусу. Кредит берет для аренды нового помещения и приобретния продуктов.
texts.en: Rahmatsho lives in the Dangara district.  He is 31 years old and married.  Rahmatsho has been baking and selling samosas for over five years.  He is requesting this loan to lease a new space and purchase products.

loans.use: to lease a new space and purchase products

loans.name: Chepsai Group

texts.en:
Edward is the facilitator of the Chepsai group. Edward and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Edward takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Edward had an excellent maize yield harvesting nine bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Edward was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Edward and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Edward will educate his children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Chepsai group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Edward is pictured with his group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a hardworking businessman, aged 29. He is married and blessed with four children, all of whom are in school. 
Walter has been running a carpentry business for the last nine years to support his family. He employs two people to assist him in managing the business. He has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. 
Walter is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy timber and paint. Thanks to Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving. In the next five years, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy timber and paint.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира замужем имеет четверых детей . Семья большая. Она занимается выпечкой хлеба. На рынке Панчшанбе – это центральный рынок. Имеет помещение в аренду. Бизнес востребованы. От продажи хлеба имеет хорошую выручку, что помогает в содержании семьи. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 1500 долларов США для оптовой закупки муки. Она весьма благодарна тем, кто ее поддержит, потому что под праздники можно получить хороший доход. Спасибо тем, кто протянет руку помощи.
texts.en: Nodira is married and has four children.  Her family is large.  She is involved in baking bread at the Panchshanbe market, which is the central market.  Nodira leases her business space.  Her business is in demand.  Nodira makes a good profit from the sales of bread, which helps with supporting her family.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1500 for the wholesale purchase of flour.  She is quite grateful to all, who will support her because she can make a good profit before the holidays.  Thank you to all, who will extend a helping hand.

loans.use: to purchase flour at a wholesale price

loans.name: Sango Group

texts.en:
Crescent is the facilitator of the Sango group. Crescent and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Crescent takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Crescent had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Crescent was only able to harvest five bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Crescent and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Crescent will educate his children and repay his loan.

In 2012, the members of Sango group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase better manure for her farms.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 42-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of twenty and four. All of them are in school. For eight years she has had a business selling ice cream in Buluk, South Sudan.

Grace requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use the extra income she gains as a result of this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for sale.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is a 42-year-old married woman with five sons and one daughter. Her husband is a worker with a decent salary, and one of her sons is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary, too. 
Ilham is a professional tailor. She wants to expand her business and buy another sewing machine as demand has increased for her services. However, the amount of money she has isn't sufficient to buy a new machine, so she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner FATEN. When Ilham receives the loan, she will purchase another sewing machine to help her finish her tailoring work faster. She has loyal customers and keeping her word to finish the tailoring on time is very important to her in building a good reputation. This loan will allow her to maximize her tailoring work and increase her income, which will provide her family with better living conditions. 
Ilham is shown in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nassif

texts.en: Nassif is 33 years old, single and has worked as a carpenter for the last 13 years. He opened his own business in 2004 and has done really well because he works hard and is highly respected by his customers. Because his business is growing, he has decided to apply for a loan to buy more of the tools and machines he needs to do high-quality, professional work. He also hopes to expand his business by making furniture as well as doors and closets. His goal for the future is to open a large manufacturing company which supplies products all over Lebanon.

loans.use: to buy more tools and machines for a carpentry business.

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en:
Nicholus is a hardworking businessman, aged 26. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last seven years, he has been running a retail shop in order to support his family. He also runs a grocery business to supplement his income. He employs two people to assist him in managing the business. 
Nicholus has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy salt, sugar and milk for resale. Thanks to Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving. In the next five years, he plans to establish a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
For the last two years, Emmanuel has been in the livestock trade. He earns a monthly profit of KES. 30,000. He is 25 and single.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

He will invest the profits back into the business. He hopes to grow his business, open a butchery, and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура любящая мать и примерная домохозяйка. У нее трое детей. Замужем. Они вместе с мужем стараются заработать и создать все условия для содержания семьи. Она  с детства любила шить и впоследствии стала заниматься пошивом национальных женских платьев. Труд нелегкий. Все женщины любят красиво одеваться и в настоящее время в моду вошли платья с вышивками. Поэтому она хочет получить займ в размере 3000 сомони для покупки вышивальной машинки. Она уверенна, что вы ее поддержите и поможете в покупке данной швейной машинки. Она благодарна вам за помощь
texts.en: Manzura is a loving mother and an exemplary housewife.  She is married and has three children.  Her husband and she try to earn and provide all of the necessary conditions to support the family.  Manzura loved to sew since childhood and then became involved in sewing women's national dresses.  This is not easy work.  All women love to dress well, and currently, there is a trend for dresses with embroidery.  This is why she wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 3000 somoni to purchase an embroidery machine.  Manzura is certain that you would support and help her with the purchase of this sewing machine.  She is grateful to you for the help.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years. He is 36 years old, married to Milka and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and farm inputs. Buying spraying chemicals and seedlings as well as getting more labour are also part of his plans.

In the future, Simon hopes to improve his farming methods and make more income to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm inputs.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is married and blessed with a three-year-old child who is in school. She describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman. She runs a cosmetics shop to make a living. She has been in this business for the last seven years. 
Since Pauline joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. With her loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings, she plans to buy body lotions and hair weaves for resale. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy body lotions and hair weaves.

loans.name: Senjula B Group

texts.en:
Maccabeth is the facilitator of the Senjula B group. Maccabeth and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

He takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Maccabeth had a good maize yield harvesting seven bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Maccabeth and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from his maize sales, Maccabeth will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Senjula B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie has practiced livestock farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years. She is 31 years old, married to Joel, and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy a cow which she will rear and use to produce milk. 

Due to the ready and stable market for milk in the area and beyond, Winnie hopes in the future to become one of the leading dairy farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chi Stephine

texts.en:
Chi Stephine was born in 1946, and is married. He lives with his five children, one of whom is under 15, in a six-room house in Ntambah, a quarter in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. Chi Stephine has faced many challenges in life, including ill health, death and poverty.

Chi Stephine joined Kiva partner GHAPE on August 3rd 2005 and has successfully taken and repaid loans four times. The profit from his most recent loan was used to buy medication, education and the building of rooms in his compound. He strongly believes his business will succeed because of better management skills and the keeping of records to enable him to take decisions when necessary. His business will help people in his community who will not have to go far from home to purchase manure for their agricultural products.

The profit from this loan will enable Chi Stephine to buy medication in cases of ill health, build more rooms in his compound, and also expand his business by ploughing back some of the profit into the business. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because education is given before loan disbursement, interest rates are low compared to other financial institutions, and it offers a convenient time of payment.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, yam seedlings and feed.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is 28 years old, married and the mother of two children. She has been selling fish for the last two years, with a monthly profit of KES 5,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to purchase additional stocks of fish for sale. 

Kache plans to save the profit she makes and use it to help pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and own a fish depot in the area.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Mbakara Group

texts.en:
Benard is the facilitator of the Mbakara group. Benard and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Benard takes care of 11 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Benard had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Benard was only able to harvest five bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benard and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Benard will save for the future
.
