In 2012, the members of Mbakara group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat, a hardworking 36-year-old businessman, is married and blessed with a five-year-old child who is in school. For the last ten months he has been operating a posho mill to make a living, employing one person to assist him.

Since joining Faulu Kenya, Josephat has been able to access loans to boost his enterprise and is now requesting a loan of 65,000 Kenya shillings to renovate his business premises. Within the next five years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to renovate his business premises.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan, a 33-year-old young married mother of three sons and two daughters, operates a grocery store. Because she wants to increase the range of products available to her customers, Hanan is requesting a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. The resulting product acquisition should increase her sales and income, thereby leading to better living conditions for her family.

Hanan is a conservative woman, so her 18-year-old son Mohammad is shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Muendi

texts.en: Muendi is single and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. She describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman. She has been running a grocery business for the last seven years to support her family. She also runs a business washing cars to supplement her income. She has employed one person to assist her to manage the business. Muendi is requesting a loan of 9000 KES to buy tomatoes, fruits and vegetables for resale. In the next five years, she plans to establish a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has operated his boutique in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eight years. He is 42 years old, married to Wanjiku, and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more goods such as cosmetics, skin and hair oil, men and women's wear to stock his boutique.

In the future, Peter hopes to expand his business by opening beauty shops in other areas. He would like to employ more people, hence providing employment to the people in his area and also improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more goods for his boutique.

loans.name: C 8913 Twizamure Group

texts.en:
Laurence is 51 years old and has three children between the ages of 9 and 20. She owns a fruit business, which is open from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day except on Sunday. She is the leader of the group, which is called "C 8913 TWIZAMURE" in the local language. She is the second person from the right side. 

Laurence has 10 years of experience in this work and she has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more fruits such as bananas for resale. With any profit from the loan, she will save money for her future and pay her children's school fees. Laurence hopes to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits such as bananas for resale.

loans.name: Bahati Shg Group

texts.en:
Byron is the facilitator of the Bahati SHG group. Byron and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Byron takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Byron had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Byron was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Byron and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Byron will educate his children and use the rest of the cash for domestic use.

In 2012, the members of Bahati SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Byron is pictured with his group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.ru: Зафарджон молодой перспективный парень Он семьянин, имеет двоих детей. Он занимается купле продажей. Яиц. Это очень востребованный вид товара, который быстро реализуется. Он хотел бы получить 3000 долларов для оптового закупа товара. К праздникам очень поднимутся цены и он хотел бы закупить товар. Он надеетя на вашу поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Zafarjon is young and promising young man.  He is a family man and has two children.  He is involved in buying and selling eggs.  This is a highly demanded product, which gets sold quickly.  Zafarjon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 to purchase product at a wholesale price.  Prices will rise a lot for the holidays, and he wants to buy the product now.  He hopes to get your support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase eggs

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta is a 45 year old married woman with nine children between the ages of 25 and 5.  Six of them are in school.  She has a business of selling soft drinks in bulk in South Sudan for the last four years.
Marta requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase soda, and cold water.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soda, and cold water for sale.

loans.name: L'union De Senzidor Group

texts.fr:
JeanP.  est le coordinateur  de son groupe l`union de senzidor.

JeanP.   habite dans la région nord  d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

JeanP.  a dirigé son commerce  de vente de cabrit durant les 2 dernières  années.

Avant de commencer ce commerce, JeanP. etait un enseignant

JeanP.  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt dans l'achat des cabrit pour revendre. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce.

Des autres membres de l`union de senzidor ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vente de produits alimentaires et cosmétiques et charbon
JeanP. dit que son défi principal il n y a pas des acheteurs constants.et vente credit qui lui rend difícil

JeanP. dit que son rêve c`est d`avoir un plus grand grand dans esperanza pour obtenir un plus grand commere.
texts.en:
JeanP. is the coordinator of the group “Union de Senzidor”. He lives in the northern region of Haïti, where electricity is scarce and water supplies are very limited. He sells kid goats, a business he has been running for the past 2 years. Prior to that activity, he was a teacher

JeanP. will use his loan to purchase kid goats for resale. He hopes that this credit will help him to expand his business. Other members of “Union de Senzidor” require a loan for activities such as the sale of food, cosmetic products and charcoal. 

JeanP.’s main challenge is the lack of repeat customers. Selling on credit also makes things difficult for him. His dream is to expand his business with more help from Esperanza.

loans.use: to buy kid goats for resale

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah is a focused businesswoman who is 37 years old. She is single and blessed with two children who are in school. For the last seven years, she has been selling clothes to support her family. She also does farming to supplement her income. She describes her business as busy since her potential customers are the passersby and local residents. In the next five years, she plans to manage a wholesale business. Peninah has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy a stock of clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Madine

texts.en:
Madine is 34 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 2 and 14. Her business is clean and doing well. She sells various goods such as cooking oil, vegetables, tomatoes, etc. Madine has eight years experience in this business. Her business is open from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except on Sunday.

Madine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as cooking oil, vegetables, tomatoes, etc. to sell. With any profit from the loan, Madine will expand her business. Madine hopes also to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as cooking oil, vegetables, tomatoes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Wambua

texts.en: Wambua is a hardworking businessman who is 25 years old. He is married and blessed with two children, one of whom is in school. He runs a retail shop to make a living. He also does farming to increase his income. He has employed one person to assist him in managing the business. Wambua has been able to retain his business because of a good reputation with his customers. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy bread, sugar and rice for resale. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy bread, sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Ushindi B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ushindi B Group in Western Kenya! Julia is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Julia takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had a very maize yield harvesting nine bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Julia was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Julia and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from her maize sales, Julia will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Ushindi B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mame Coumba

texts.fr:
Mme Mame Coumba  est une jeune marchande de 30 ans qui loge dans un village un peu éloigné du guichet. Cela ne l’empêche pas  de mouvementer son compte pour bénéficier des services de l’Institution. Elle est mariée. Elle  a démarré son activité depuis 2006 et vend des habits pour enfants.
C’est en effet pour renforcer son activité qu’elle demande du crédit. Elle n’a aucune  charge :elle est entièrement  gérer par son époux.
Les bénéfices de son activité serviront à augmenter son capital et son fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mame Coumba is a 30 year old saleswoman who lives in a village at a considerable distance from her lender. 
This does not stop her from using her account to take advantage of the services of the institution.  She is married.  She started her work in 2006 and sells children’s clothing. 
She wants to increase her business so she has requested a loan.  She does not have anyone in her care; she is completely supported by her husband. 
Her loan will allow her to increase her income and her working capital.

loans.use: to buy children's shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. For the last five years, she has been running a grocery business to support her family. She has been able to retain her business because of a good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she plans to expand her business. Caroline is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy small fish (omena), tomatoes and fruits for resale. She expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care.

loans.use: To buy small fish, tomatoes and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 35 year old business man, who lives in Juba.  He is married and has three children between the ages of 17 and 10.  All of them go to school. 

Joseph runs a bar business, and he has been in the business for 5 years.  He has one employee.
Peter heard about Finance Sudan through the promotion and marketing done by the loans officers.  He is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase items like beer, soda, and many other different types of drinks.  Joseph has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Joseph would like to increase the size of the business.

His major challenges include home expenses and a low income rate.

Joseph says that he is happy to see MFI's operating in South Sudan and helping them with loans, which means the country is developing.

loans.use: to purchase items like beer, soda, and many other different types of drinks.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 50 year old married woman with seven children between the ages of 23 and 7.  All of them are in school.  She has a business of selling charcoal in bulk in South Sudan for eight years.
Hellen requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and hair products to resell.

loans.name: Mungakha Group

texts.en:
Shatome is the facilitator of the Mungakha group. Shatome and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Shatome takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Shatome had a good maize yield harvesting six bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Shatome was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Shatome and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Shatome will educate his children and repay the loan.

In 2012, the members of Mungakha group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jasho Women Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Jasho Women Group in Western Kenya! Rael is the facilitator of the Jasho Women group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rael takes care of 11 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rael had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rael was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rael and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rael will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Jasho Women group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Rael with her group members. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nandika Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nandika Group in Western Kenya! By the leadership of Emily as their facilitator, this group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Emily takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Emily was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Emily and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from her maize sales, Emily will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Nandika group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Baheja

texts.en:
Baheja is a 48-year-old woman. She is married and has three sons and four daughters. Her husband (pictured) is an employee of the Ministry of Education, and he earns a decent salary. 

Baheja has an internet cafe, and she wants to improve it by making some repairs such as painting, installing lights, etc. Also, she wants to increase the number of computers used by her customers in her cafe. However, the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for all this, so she needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,000 from FATEN. 

When Baheja gets the loan, she will pay to improve the cafe's conditions by doing the necessary repairs and purchasing additional computers to increase her customers and her income. This will enable her to provide her family with better living conditions. Baheja is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead of her in the internet cafe.

loans.use: To make some repairs to her internet cafe and to purchase more computers.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a 35-year-old businessman, lives in Juba where he is married and has three children between the ages of eight and three, two of whom go to school. Peter has been operating a mixed food store for six years, and has one employee. His major challenges include competitors and home expenses. Within the next five years, he would like to build his own shop because he is now renting.

Peter, who learned about Finance Sudan through a promotion done by the loan officers, is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase items including sugar, powdered milk, tang juice, and rice. He says that the loan will help his business a great deal, and has an interest rate that is better than other micro-finance institutions.

loans.use: to purchase items like sugar, powdered milk, tang juice, and rice.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: La señora Maricela a sus 29 años de edad es madre de dos hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad, es una emprendedora quien desea iniciar su propio negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, tal como blue jeans, camisetas y ropa interior. La señora Maricela tiene experiencia en esta labor puesto que trabajo durante tres años en un almacen de venta de ropa. La señora Maricela desea vender este tipo de mercancia a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, para lo cual necesita comprar surtido con el cual puedea suplir la demanda de la temporada de fin de año. Con lo anterior la señora Maricela podrá tener mejores ingresos y a su vez mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo e hijos. El sueño de la señora Maricela es tener su propio almacen y con este generar empleos directos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Maricela, at 29 years old, is the mother of two children, ages 12 and 8.  She is an entrepreneur who wants to start her own business selling clothing for women, men, and children, such as blue jeans, t-shirts, and underwear.  Maricela has experience in this job because she worked for three years in a department store that sells clothes.

Maricela wants to sell this type of merchandise to her friends, family members, and neighbors, so she needs to buy stock with which to be able to supply the demand of the end-of-year season.  With this Maricela will be able to have better income and, in turn, improve the quality of life of her husband and children.

Maricela's dream is to have her own store and with it generate direct jobs in her community.

loans.use: to buy stock clothing items.

loans.name: Haychatou

texts.fr:
Haychétou  est une jeune marchande  âgée de 28 ans  et célibataire. Elle  s’active dans la vente de denrées alimentaire depuis 4 ans déjà 
Avec le prêt, elle veut renforcer son activé  en augmentant ses marchandises et en même temps acheter un mouton pour les fêtes de la Tabaski
Haychatou vit chez  ses parents et n’a aucune charge ce qui fait que ses bénéfices  sont reversés dans  son capital.
texts.en: Haychatou is a young, single, 28-year-old merchant. She has been actively selling food for four years already. With the loan, she wants to strengthen her business by increasing her merchandise and also buy a sheep for the Tabaski celebrations. Haychatou lives with her parents and doesn't need to look after anyone which means that her profits are put back into her capital.

loans.use: to buy food and a sheep for Tabaski.

loans.name: Mutio

texts.en:
For the last 20 years, Mutio has been running a salon. She earns a monthly profit of KES 21,000. She is a 51-year-old single mother with three children. 

She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after paying back the previous loans fully and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more salon products like weaves, cosmetics, braids, shampoo, and nail polish. 

She will save the profits she makes and provide for her family's basic needs. Mutio hopes to grow her business and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more salon products like weaves, cosmetics, braids, shampoo, and nail polish.

loans.name: Jairo De Jesus

texts.es:
Dedicado a la agricultura la mayor parte de su vida y con la ayuda de sus 4 hijos de 32, 30, 28, 26 años respectivamente les ha demostrado a ellos y a toda su comunidad que si se trabaja con esmero, tesón y alegría se pueden conseguir las metas de la mejor manera. Jairo enseña a los jóvenes de su comunidad a que aprendan sobre el cultivo y la tierra. 

Este gran emprendedor necesita el crédito para comprar insumos y material agrícola para sacar adelante su cultivo y poder comercializar mucho mejor sus productos y continuar con las enseñanzas a todos los jóvenes que ven en Jairo un gran ejemplo de vida.
texts.en:
Working in agriculture the better part of his life and with the help of his four children, ages 32, 30, 28, and 26 respectively, has shown them and the whole community that if you work with care, determination, and happiness, you can reach your goals in the best way.  Jairo teaches the young people of his community to learn about crops and the land.

This great entrepreneur needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies and materials to get his crop ahead, to be able to sell his products better, and to continue with his lessons to all the young people, who see in Jairo a great example of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and materials to take care of his crop.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a hardworking businessman who is 45 years old. He is married and blessed with three children, all of whom are in school. For the last 20 years, he has been selling ornaments such as earrings, necklaces and bangles to make a living. He also rents houses to supplement his income. He has employed two people to help him in managing the business. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to buy iron sheets to be used to renovate his rental houses. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to be used to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Makatini Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Makatini Group in Western Kenya! Alice is the facilitator of the Makatini group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alice takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Alice will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Makatini group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Khaka Women Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Khaka Women Group in Western Kenya! Joan is the facilitator of the Khaka Women group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joan takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Joan had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Joan was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joan and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Joan will educate her children and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Khaka Women group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Joan with her group members and the field officer who is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ushindi A Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Ushindi A Group in Western Kenya! It is headed by Josephine as the facilitator. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

She takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund's best prices offered and to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, she had an excellent maize yield harvesting 30 bags on 1 1/2 acres of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on 1 1/2 acres of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Josephine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from her maize sales, Josephine will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in business. In 2012, the members of Ushindi A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 29 year old married woman with six children between the ages of 12 and 5 months. Five of her children are in school. For five years, she has had a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan. 

Elizabeth requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. In the future, she hopes to use the additional income she generates from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: La señora Sandra a sus 37 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 5 meses de edad. La señora Sandra es una emprendedora quien hace 8 años decide iniciar su propio negocio de confección y comercialización de bolsos. El taller de la señora Sandra está ubicado en su casa y los bolsos los comercializa con sus amigos, familiares  y referidos. La señora Sandra requiere de la compra de insumos como telas, cierres e hilos para la confección de sus bolsos que aumentará gracias a la temporada de fin de año. Con lo anterior, los ingresos de la señora Sandra aumentarían y de esta forma podría mejorar la calidad de vida de su bebé y de su esposo. El sueño de la señora Sandra es tener su empresa de bolsos muy bien posicionada en el mercado y generar empleos directos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Sandra, at 37 years old, is the mother of a five-month-old child.  Sandra is an entrepreneur who decided eight years ago to start her own business making and selling purses.  Sandra's workshop is located in her house, and she sells the bags to her friends, relatives, and referrals.

Sandra needs the loan to buy materials such as fabric, clasps, and thread to make her bags, which she will increase thanks to the end-of-the-year season.  With this, Sandra's income would increase and in this way she would be able to improve the quality of life of her baby and of her husband.

Sandra's dream is to have her bag business very well positioned in the market and to generate direct jobs in her community.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 36-year-old business woman, who lives in Juba. She is married and has 5 children between the ages of 19 and 3. Three of her children go to school. 

Jane runs a food store, and she has been in the business for two years. She has no employees. Jane heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients. She is taking a loan of 1,000 SDG to purchase more food items such as tomatoes, green vegetables, onions, and many other products. This business is Jane's only source of income.  

In five years time, Jane likes to hope that her business will grow and she will have a good store only selling food. 

Her major challenges include paying for her children to go to school because the school fees in Juba are expensive.   

Jane says that she is happy at Finance Sudan’s support which is especially aimed at helping women to get capital to start up a business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items such as tomatoes, green vegetables and onions.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 46-year-old married woman with eight children between the ages of 19 and 5. All of them are in school. For four years, she has had a business selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan. 

Susan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She aims to use the extra profits she generates as a result of this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Tumaini Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tumaini SHG Group in Western Kenya! Evelyn is the facilitator of the Tumaini SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Evelyn takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Evelyn had a good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Evelyn was only able to harvest 7 1/2 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Evelyn and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Evelyn will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tumaini SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Senjula A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Senjula A Group in Western Kenya! Japheth is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Japheth takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Japheth had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest four bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Japheth and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from his maize sales, Japheth will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Senjula A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Fortunee

texts.en:
Fortunee is 39 years old and is married with two children, ages 4 and 12. Her business is doing well. She sells various secondhand clothes in the market, and she has 10 years' experience in this business. Fortunee employs one person to help her. Her business is open from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except on Sunday.

Fortunee has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various secondhand clothes to sell. With any profit from the loan, Fortunee will expand her business and help her family. Fortunee also hopes to renovate her house with her profits.

loans.use: to purchase various secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is married and blessed with four children who are in school. 

For the last six years, she has been running a grocer business to support her family. She also practices poultry farming to supplement her income. She has employed one person to assist her to manage the business. 

Hellen has been able to retain her business because of good reputation with her customers. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy potatoes, fruits and vegetables for resale. 

In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. 

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become more financially stable.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is 29 years old and married. She has two children, ages 3 and 6 years old. 

Her business is clean and good. She sells African clothes in the market. She has five years experience in this business and employs one person to help her. Her business runs from 9 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day.

Furaha has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more African clothes for resale. 

With any profit from the loan, Furaha will expand her business and save for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more African clothes for resale.

loans.name: Risiki Group

texts.en:
Laban is the facilitator of the Risiki group. Laban and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Laban and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Laban takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Laban had a very good maize yield harvesting 24 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Laban was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Laban will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Risiki group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Laban with his group members. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en:
Leyla is a 27 year old a married woman. She has two children, aged 4 and 7 years, both in school. Leyla has had a business of selling tea in Buluk, South Sudan for four years.

Leyla has requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will save her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar to sell.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: La señora Ana Lucía a sus 43 años de edad es madre de un hijo; se dedica desde hace más de 12 años en su propio taller a la confección de prendas de vestir y uniformes. La señora Ana Lucía aprendió esta labor de una amiga quien le enseño. La señora Ana Lucía trabaja en su taller con una vecina y un familiar. La señora Ana Lucía desea comprar una maquina filetiadora con la cual pueda mejorar los tiempos de entrega de los pedidos. Con lo anterior, la señora Ana Lucía podrá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño de la señora Ana Lucía es tener un gran taller de confecciones y con este generar empleos directos para sus amigos y familiares.
texts.en: At the age of 43, Mrs. Ana Lucía has one child and has worked in her own sewing workshop for 12 years. She makes clothing and uniforms, and learned this work from a friend. Ana Lucia works with a neighbour and a family member in her workshop. She wants to buy an overlock sewing machine in order to improve her production; it will take her less time to complete an order with this machine. With this loan, Ana Lucia will be able to increase her income and improve her family's quality of life. Her dream is to have a large workshop and generate direct employment for her friends and family.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 27 years old and married. She has two children age 1 and 6 years old. 

Pelagie owns a business selling sorghum. Her business is well known and well organized and she has four years of experience in this business. She currently employs three people to help her and her business runs from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. per week except on Sunday.

Pelagie has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company in order to buy large quantities of sorghum for resale. With any profit, Pelagie will reinvest her profits in her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Nadim

texts.en:
Nadim is a 49-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three school-aged children. In 2008, he opened a small farm from which he raises cattle and sells dairy products. In addition, he has been working as a nurse for the past six years on a free-lance basis. As for his wife, she has twenty one years of experience and works in a local university. 

Today, Nadim is requesting to borrow $ 2100 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a cow for his farm. This loan will help to enhance his productivity, therefore, his sales and his revenues. In the future, he plans to raise more cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for his farm.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 30-year-old married lady who has one daughter. Her husband works in a private company.

Three years ago Yasmeen opened a small beauty salon to practice what she got training on, and through these three years, she was able to expand and add more seats and addmore services preparing brides' make-up and hair styles. 

Now Yasmeen has applied for a loan to buy new equipment and repair a few things in the salon.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and repair a few things in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Njete Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Njete Group in Western Kenya! Ruth is the facilitator of the Njete group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ruth takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ruth had a good maize yield harvesting 17 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ruth was only able to harvest 15 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ruth and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Ruth will educate her children and invest in business.

In 2012, the members of Njete group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and blessed with five children who are in school. 

She has been running a cafeteria for the last ten years to support her family. She has employed three people to assist her in the business. She describes her business as busy since her potential customers are the local residents and passersby. 

Since Rose joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. 

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy ingredients such as cooking fat, sugar and wheat flour. 

In the next five years, she plans to open another outlet of her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: Nambami A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nambami A Group in Western Kenya! Geofrey is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Geofrey takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed his family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, he had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 1/2 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Geofrey and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from his maize sales, Geofrey will invest in livestock rearing and business to raise his living standard. In 2012, the members of Nambami A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy skirts, shirts and belts.

loans.name: Calvery Shg Group

texts.en:
Ellah is the facilitator of the Calvery SHG group. Ellah and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ellah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Ellah joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ellah had a very good maize yield, harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ellah was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Ellah will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Calvery SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Ellah with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Diriangen Group

texts.es:
El grupo Diriangen está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosa del Carmen se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace diez años en el mirador. Ella con el crédito comprara granos básicos, pollo, carbón, leña, gaseosa, jugo…etc. con el fin que su negocio crezca.

Las otras integrantes es María Auxiliadora vende nacatamales con el crédito comprara materia prima (chiltoma, maíz, cerdo, tomate, arroz, cebolla, hoja, leña…etc.) y Alba Luz quien se dedica a la venta de artesanías ella invertirá en barro, pintura de agua, acabado, leña y horno…etc.
texts.en:
The communal bank Diriangen consists of 3 hardworking and determined women one of whom is Rosa del Carmen. She has been selling food for the last 10 years at the lookout. With the loan she will buy dry grains, chicken, coal, firewood, soft drinks, juice, etc., with the aim of growing her business.

The other members of the group are María Auxiliadora who sells tamales and who with the loan will buy raw materials (banana leaves, sweet chillis, corn, pork, tomatoes, rice, onions, leaves, firewood, etc.) and Alba Luz who sells handicrafts and who will invest her loan in clay, watercolours, glaze, firewood and oven.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food especially dry grains, chicken, coal, firewood, soft drinks, juice, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Peter has been in the transport industry and earns a monthly profit of KES 20,000. He is 39 years old, married to Annah and has three school aged children. 

Peter is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the loan amount to buy spare parts to repair the motor bike. He will save the anticipated profits and provide basic needs for his family. Peter hopes to grow his business and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Nour Aldeen

texts.en:
Nour Aldeen is a 19-year-old young man, who is one of six brothers and sisters in his family. 

Nour Aldeen is a student in his second year studying how to make electricity extensions in buildings. Now he has applied for a loan to pay his semester tuition so he can continue and get his bachelor's degree and work in his major field.

loans.use: to pay his semester tuition.

loans.name: Kimanzi

texts.en:
Kimanzi is married and blessed with two children who are in school. 

For the last five years, he has been running a welding business to support his family. He also does farming to increase his income. He has employed two people to assist him to manage the business. His potential customers are the local residents. 

He is requesting a loan of 100,000 KES to buy metals. 

In the next five years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy metals.

loans.name: Dora Piedad

texts.es: La señora Dora a sus 48 años de edad es madre de tres hijos de 27, 18, y 4 años de edad. La señora Dora lleva más de ocho años prestando en su propio local el servicio de peluquería. La señora Dora es viuda, lo que hace que trabaje arduamente día a día en su salón de belleza para sacar adelante a sus hijos. La señora Dora requiere de hacer adecuaciones locativas al baño de su negocio tal como el arreglo del piso, las paredes y las tuberías.  Con lo anterior, la señora Dora podrá prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El sueño de la señora Dora es agrandar su negocio y que esté posicionado en el sector.
texts.en: Señora Dora is 48 years old and is the mother of 3 children aged 27, 18 and 4 years. Señora Dora has been a hairdresser in her neighbourhood for more than 8 years. Señora Dora is a widow which means that she must work hard every day in her beauty salon to raise her children. Señora Dora needs to make imporvements to her salon's bathroom such as mending the floor, the walls and the pipes. With these improvements, Señora Dora will be able to offer her clients a better service. Señora Dora's dream is to grow her business and be well positioned in the sector.

loans.use: to make improvements to the bathroom.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 2 years. He is 21 years old and single. He was introduced to KADET by one of our existing clients and this will be his 1st loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods like maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat to sell in his retail shop and thereby increase his income.

In the future, Simon hopes to expand his business and invest in other areas of Ndunyu Njeru town. He aspires to become the best business entrepreneur, hence improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock like maize flour, tea leaves, cooking fat to sell.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 35 years old and is married with four children, age 2 to 12 years old. 

Her business is clean and good. She sells milk. Odette has eight years experience in this business and employs two people to help her. Her business runs from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day.

Odette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her milk sales. With any profit from the loan, Odette will reinvest in her business and to save for her family.

loans.use: To expand her milk sales.

loans.name: Revolucion De Ferrier 2, 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.fr:
Amboise est le coordinatrice de son groupe Revolution de ferrier. Il est  mariee il est possede 3 enfants.

Amboise  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir aven duit du quincaillerie. Amboise espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son bussness

Des autres membres Revolution de ferrier  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon et ken kay.

Amboise dit que ses défis principal est de venie une grande commercant. Amboise habite dans la région de  ferrier d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité Amboise a dirigé son  commerce de quincallerie pendant les 6  dernières années.
texts.en:
Amboise is the coordinator of his group Revolution de ferrier. He is married and has three children. 

Amboise would like to use this loan to invest in hardware products. Amboise hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. 

Other members of Revolution de ferrier need a loan for businesses such as coal and odds and ends.

Amboise says that his main challenge is to become a great businessman. Amboise lives in the ferrier region of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is scarce. Amboise has been managing his hardware business for the past six years.

loans.use: to buy hardware products.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and only one child. They really depend on him especially because of the heavy costs of life. 

Ali opened his own bakery in 2008 and he’s looking forward to further grow the business. For this reason, he’s requesting, today, a loan of $1600 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed raw materials for his bakery such as sugar, flour and many other products. He notes that this kiva loan will help him to earn a superior income. In the future, he plans to collect money and to enlarge his bakery to be able to receive more customers.

loans.use: to purchase the needed raw materials for his bakery such as sugar, flour and many other products.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
El socio Guido se sigue dedicando al negocio de taller de carpinteria,el hace trbajos como muebles,mesas y puertas de madera y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en la ciudad de cusco,por medio de estos negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de taller de carpinteria.El socio solicita el credito para comprar madera y herramientas para la carpinteria.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Guido still has his carpentry business. He makes furniture, tables and doors from wood and subsequently sells them at the different street markets in the city of Cusco. By means of this business, the member takes care of his children. The member wants to expand and improve his carpentry workshop. The member is asking for a loan to buy wood and carpentry tools.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to makes the repayments.

.

loans.use: to buy wood and tools for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal is 36 years old and widowed. She works in a photography studio taking photos for people whether in the studio or at their parties such as  wedding parties.

After gaining experience in photography, Feryal decided to start her own business using her connections, so as a start she has applied for a loan to buy a new  professional digital camera and a PC so she can one day have her own studio.

loans.use: to buy a new professional  digital camera and a PC.

loans.name: Deymi Group

texts.es:
El grupo Deymi lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadora y emprendedoras una de ellas es Keny quien inicio vendiendo sopa y vaho los fines de semana luego con los prestamos empezó a vender fritangas. Ella con el préstamo comprará verduras, carne, hueso, tortillas, repollo, arroz, aceite…etc.
Las otras integrantes es Araceli Carolina vende granos básicos, frutas y verduras desde hace 7 años y Marina del Socorro vende ropa y plata desde hace 1 año.
texts.en:
The communal bank group Deymi consists of 3 hardworking and determined women one of whom is Keny who started off by selling soup and vajo (a tradition Nicaraguan dish of meat, green plantains and yuca) at the weekends and subsequently with the loans started to sell fritangas (fried pork ribs served with rice and beans). With the loan, she will buy vegetables, meat, bones, tortillas, cabbage, rice, oil, etc.

The other members of the group are Araceli Carolina who has sold dry grains, fruit and vegetables for the last 7 years and Marina del Socorro who has been selling clothes and silver for the last year.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, bones, tortillas, cabbage, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 48-year-old Illiterate woman who has seven sons and daughters. The oldest son has already gotten married.

Being an illiterate woman has given her the urge to make sure that her sons and daughters finish their studies at school, and for that reason Maryam has now applied for a loan to pay her daughter Azhar's semester fees so she can continue her studies in nursing. 

Azhar who appears in the photo next to her mother, Maryam, is now in her second year and is hoping to work in a Jordanian hospital after graduating.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Upendo Group in Western Kenya! Ebby is the facilitator of the Upendo group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ebby  takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ebby had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 24 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ebby was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ebby  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Ebby will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Upendo group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Brenda Rosa

texts.es: La señora Brenda B. es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado desde hace 15 años. Ella distribuye su mercadería en Costa Rica, según comento le ha ido muy bien. Ella este crédito lo necesita para surtirse de mercadería en calzado y ropa por la temporada.
texts.en: Brenda B. is a hardworking, enterprising woman who’s been selling shoes and clothing for the past 15 years.  She distributes her merchandise in Costa Rica and she tells us that things are going very well for her.  She needs this loan in order to stock up her shoe and clothing merchandise for the season.

loans.use: to stock up on shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
El socio sigue teniendo su negocio de tienda de abarrotes que junto a su esposa trabajan en este negocio y tambien sigue trabajando como chofer en el servicio de taxi que hace la ruta hacia el distrito de Anta,el socio por medio de estos trabajos la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de servicio de taxi.El socio solicita el credito para comprar productos como arroz,azucar,leche,aceite al por mayor para implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member and his wife continue running his grocery business.  He also works as a taxi driver along the route to Anta.  Together they move their children ahead in life through these businesses.  He wants to expand and improve the grocery store and taxi businesses.  He is asking for this loan in order to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil in quantity, in order to stock his store.

He is grateful for the loan and has promised to make his payments on time.

loans.use: El socio solicita el credito para comprar productos como arroz,azucar,leche,aceite al por mayor para implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

loans.name: Dedicación

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de repuestos para carros,ella vende repuestos para llantas,parabrisas y timones,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de repuestos para carros.La socia solicita el credito para comprar repuestos para carros al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member sells repair parts, such as tires, windshields, and steering wheels, for automobiles.  She works from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm and moves her children ahead in life through this business.  She wants to expand her business and buy parts in quantity.

She is grateful for this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in quantity.

loans.name: Malinche Group

texts.es:
El grupo Malinche lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosa Amanda de 67 años quien se dedica a la venta de granos, básicos, gaseosas, helados…etc. Ella invertirá el crédito en granos básicos, frijoles, chiverías y gaseosa. 
Los otros integrantes son Nester Antonio quien es técnico en refrigeración con el crédito anterior compro herramientas y actualmente con este crédito pondrá su taller y María Virginia de 32 años vende de tortilla desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The Malinche Group was formed by three hardworking, entrepreneurial people, one being 67 year old Rosa Amanda.  She sells basic grains, soft drinks, frozen treats, etc.  She will use the money from this loan to invest in basic grains, beans, beer, and soft drinks.

The other members are Nester Antonio, who is a refrigeration technician and used the money from the previous loan to buy tools for his workshop, and María Virginia who’s been selling tortillas for two years.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en: Salah is a 26-year-old man. He lives with his parents and four working siblings. Together they manage to fulfill their family's needs. Despite his young age, Salah decided to open his own internet and video games shop in 2008.  With his good reputation, he has gained a fair number of loyal customers. People meet at his place every day to enjoy their time. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, to purchase two additional computers to be used by his customers. In the future, he plans to open his own entertainment center.

loans.use: to purchase two additional computers

loans.name: Matisi Shg Group

texts.en:
Vincent is the facilitator of the Matisi SHG group. Vincent and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Vincent takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Vincent had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 8 ½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Vincent was only able to harvest 2 ½ bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Vincent and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Vincent will educate his children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Matisi SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Seily Ivonett

texts.es: La señora Sely es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de comida. Este negocio lo inicio hace 15 años y poco a poco lo ha ido mejorando ahora cuenta con seis trabajadores y vende más. Ella con el crédito comprara granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, aceite) carne, pollo, verduras, leña…etc.
texts.en: Sely is a hardworking entrepreneurial woman who sells food.  She started this business 15 years ago and has been improving it little by little.  She now has six employees and her sales have increased.  She will use the money from this loan to buy basic grains (rice, beans, cooking oil), meat, chicken, vegetables, firewood, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Merali

texts.es: La señora Merali es una fémina trabajadora y emprendedora de 31 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 4 años con uno ahorros empezó ella sola en la actualidad cuenta con 7 trabajadores y un venta mayor. Ella con el crédito comprara productos para el negocio en especial granos básicos, carne, verduras, leña…etc.
texts.en: Señora Merali is a hard-working and enterprising woman, age 31. She has sold food for four years, and started this business on her own with her own savings. She now has seven employees and higher sales. With this loan she will purchase products for her business, especially basic grains, meat, vegetables, firewood, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic materials such as basic grains, meat, vegetables, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Maria Ramosa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de jardin,ella es propietaria de su jardin donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m,ella administra el jardin junto con su familia,la socia por medio de este trbajo saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el jardin.La socia solicita el credito para comprar materiales para el jardin como papeles,cartulinas,colores y plumones al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria is still running her kindergarten. She owns it and works there with her family from 8:00 am to 1:00 pm. Through this business, she is getting her children ahead. She wants to expand and improve her kindergarten, so she is requesting this loan to buy school supplies such as papers, cards, coloured pencils, and pens, wholesale.
She is happy to have this loan and promises to pay off her quotas on time.

loans.use: to buy kindergarten supplies such as paper, cards, coloured pencils, and pens wholesale.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Aurelia; La socia tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, La socia se dedica  a la atención de sus picantería en la que elabora la rica chicha de jora. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a elaborar la chicha de jora y ahora ella tiene su propia tienda en la que trabaja junto con su conyugue, que con mucho esmero se dedican al trabajo. Ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como la crianza de cuyes y gallinas, la socia compra al por mayor o en numeros pares como 20 pares de cuyes y 20 pares de gallinas, los cría, se reproducen, y los vende, la socia es muy conocida en la zona y cotizada para la compra de animales menores. En esta ocasión la socia desea el prestamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores y compra de maíz amarillo para la elaboracion de chicha de jora que es el macerado del maíz.

La socia agradece y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos en le plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Virgen Concebida de Arin" communal bank. The bank is located in the Arin district, in the province of Calca, Cusco department.

This is Mrs. Aurelia. She is 36, lives with her partner, and has two children. She tends to her food stall, where she makes delicious chicha de jora [a traditional corn liquor]. Her parents taught her to make this when she was very young, and she now has her own store where she works with her husband. They work very hard. She also raises small animals such as guinea pigs and hens. She buys several pairs of animals wholesale, for example, 20 pairs of guinea pigs and 20 pairs of hens. She raises them, they reproduce, and she sells them. She is well-known in the area and she is the go-to person for buying small animals. She currently wants a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of small animals, and of yellow corn for making chicha de jora, as it is made from marinated corn.

Aurelia is grateful for this loan and promises to repay her quotas as established.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of small animals and yellow corn for making chicha de jora [traditional corn liquor].

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es: El señor Rubén Darío a sus 52 años es padre de dos hijos, trabaja en su propia tienda desde hace más de 10 años. Actualmente, el señor Rubén Darío requiere de la compra de surtido para su tienda tal como licor que le permita suplir la demanda de este tipo de producto para las fiestas de fin de año. Esto le permitirá al señor Rubén Darío aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño del señor Rubén Darío es tener su tienda bien surtida y aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rubén Darío, age 52, has two children.  He has been working in his own store for over ten years.

Currently Rubén Darío needs to buy stock like liquor for his store.  This will allow him to meet the demand for this type of product at the end of the year festivities.  It will allow Rubén Darío to increase his income and the quality of life for his family.

Rubén Diarío’s dream is to have a well-stocked store and to increase the number of customers that he has.

loans.use: to buy stock for his store.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La socia Juana; La socia tiene 56 años D. edad, la socia es casada y  tiene 5 hijos,la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio D. salon D. belleza,ella hace trabajos D. teñidos,cortes D. cabello,ondulaciones entre otros trbajos,la socia trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. salon D. belleza . La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. materiales para implementar su salón D. belleza como bigudíes, peines, secadoras D. cabello.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Juana, age 56, is married and has five children.  She continues to devote herself to her business, a beauty parlor.  In her work she does dyes, haircuts, and permanents, among other services.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  Through this business she gets her children ahead.

She wants to expand and improve her beauty salon.  She is requesting a loan to buy materials for her beauty parlor.  She will buy things like rollers, combs, and hair dryers.

She is grateful for the support of the loan that she will receive.  She pledges to make her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy materials like rollers, combs, and hair dryers for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Silvestre Melanio

texts.es: Silvestre Melanio Chavarría O. es una persona  trabajadora que su objetivo en la vida es mejorar la vivienda donde habita con su familia, con mucho esfuerzo el ha  venido acondicionado su vivienda pero por falta de capital económico  no ha terminado de realizarle las mejoras que el necesidad. Actualmente el esta solicitando un financiamiento para poder cumplir su sueño que es comprar material para mejorar su vivienda lo que le va a comprar es Bloque, zinc, cementos, puertas, arena entre otros.
texts.en:
Silvestre Melanio Chavarría is a hard-working person.  His objective in life is to improve the home where he lives with his family.  With a great deal of effort he has been setting-up his house.  However, due to the lack of finances he has not finished making the improvements it needs.

He is currently requesting a loan to be able to fulfill his dream, which is buying materials to improve his home.  He will buy cement block, sheets of corrugated zinc, cement, doors, sand, and other items.

loans.use: to buy cement block, sheets of corrugated zinc, cement, doors, sand, and other items.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Dionisia; la socia tiene 55 años de edad, la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 4 hijos ,la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de carpinteria,ella junto con su esposo realizano trabajos como mesas,sillas,puertas y ventanas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de carpinteria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar madera,lacas y pinturas para el negocio de carpinteria. 

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Dionisia is 55 years old, is married, and has four children.  She continues to work in carpentry with her husband.  Together they build things like tables, chairs, doors, and windows.  She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm and wants to improve and expand the business.  She is asking for this loan to buy lumber, lacquers, and paints.

She is grateful for the support given her and she promises to be disciplined about making her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA D. ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito D. Arin en la provincia D. Calca y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia; tiene 62 años D. edad, la socia es viuda y tiene ocho hijos, ella tiene una pequeña casa, y está ubicado en la zona rural del Valle Sagrado D. los Incas en la comunidad D. Arin a 15 minutos D. la provincia D. Calca, y a 45 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco. Estas zonas se caracterizan por su alta actividad, agrícola, ganadera y turística que desarrollan sus pobladores.

La socia Julia se dedica principalmente a la crianza D. animales menores, la socia cria pollos y chanchos, ella hace crecer y engordar a los animales y después los venD. a sus clientes. La socia también alterna sus actividades con la elaboracion D. chicha a base D. maiz amarillo mediante un proceso D. fermentacion se obtiene la muy conocida y rica chicha D. jora, con un valor nutricional conciderable, La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. animales menores y en la compra D. maiz amarillo para la elaboracion D. chcihca D. jora.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the “VIRGEN CONCEBIDA D. ARIN” communal bank, located in the Arin district, part of the Calca province and Cusco department.

Julia is 62 years old, is a widow and has eight children.  She has a small house, located in the rural zone of the Valle Sagrado valley of the Incas, within the Arin community, located 15 minutes from the Calca province, and 45 minutes from Cusco.  These zones are known for their agriculture, livestock, and tourism.

Julia mainly raises small animals, such as chickens and pigs, fattens them up and then sells them to her customers.  She also makes yellow corn chicha (a fermented drink maD. from corn) through a fermentation process that renders the well-known and delicious chicha, with a considerable nutritional value.

She is asking for this loan to buy small animals and yellow corn to make chicha.

loans.use: La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores y en la compra de maiz amarillo para la elaboracion de chcihca de jora.

loans.name: Toula Sakho Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 09 mai 2011.Il est composé de 23
 membres qui sont issus du même village.Elles ont pour activité principale le commerce,

Mme Aissatou (à droite de la photo levant la main) est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 57 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 03 enfants,en plus elle de 03 autres enfants soient 5 enfants à prendre en charge.

Elle est ménagère et s'occupe d'un petit maraîchage.Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plusieurs années. 

Son pret va lui permettre d'acheter des intrants pour développer son activité de maraïchage.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale à travers la scolarité et la nourriture des enfants.
texts.en:
This group was formed on May 9, 2011. It consists of 23 members who are from the same town. Their primary activity is commerce.

Aissatou (to the right of the photo raising her hand) is responsible for the group. She is 57 years old, married and mother to three children. In addition, she takes care of three other children so has six children under her care.

She is a housewife and takes care of a small market garden. She has been involved in this business for several years.

Her loan will help her to buy farm inputs to develop her market garden business.

Her goal is to support her husband in taking care of the family by paying for their children's schooling and food.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Tet Trankil De Saillant 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Marc est le coordinateur de son groupe tet trankil.  Il est pas marié il a 5 enfants. Marc habite dans la ville de trou du nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Marc a dirigé son business pendant les 2 dernières années. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du charbon.

Marc espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Des autres membres de Marc ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson.

Marc dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’une moto pour transporter les materiels.
texts.en:
Marc is the coordinator of the group “Tet Ttrankil”. He is the unmarried father of five children. He lives in the town of “Trou du Nord” in Haiti, where electricity is scarce and water supplies are very limited.

Marc has been selling charcoal for the past two years. He would like to use his loan to invest in the purchase of charcoal. He hopes that this credit will help him to expand his business. Other members of the group require a loan for such businesses as the sale of charcoal, rice and fish.

Marc’s main goal is to expand his business. His dream is to buy a motorcycle to transport supplies

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia Josefina, La socia tiene 62 años D. edad, la socia es casada y  tiene 1 hijo , la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio D. deposito D. cerveza y tambien tiene su negocio D. restaurant donD. venD. desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia trabaja desD. las 10:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar le ngeocio D. venta D. cerveza y negocio D. restaurant . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,carne,pollo y verduras y tambien para comprar cerveza al por mayor.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Josefina is 62 years old, is married and has a son.  She sells beer and also has a restaurant where she sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and works from 10:00 am to 8:00 pm.  She wants to expand her businesses and is asking for this loan to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, chicken, and vegetables.  She also wants to buy beer in quantity.
